This Grimoire starts with 8 random Rudiments, though he must have at least 1 of each, and gains an additional Rudiment every level.

At level up, he then constructs his spells out of these Rudiments. These spells can’t have a Drain greater than 7 + their level (so at 1st level, his spells can only have a Drain of 6) when it is scribed into the Grimoire. A spell’s Rudiments cannot be redistributed and changed: spells in the Grimoire are immutable.

Note that spells cast by the Runegalder only last their Interval unless their Effect is stacked, in which case, it either increases that Interval by a like amount or gains the Stacking bonus. This is decided when the spell is cast.

So, a 2nd level Runegalder scribes a new spell. He can max out at 7 Drain. He chooses to make it a Wall Shape (3 Drain), at Full Range (1 Drain), Near Origin (1 Drain) and for its Effect, he choses Disorient (2 Drain), for a total of 7. He could have also made it Chain Shape instead for 1 Drain, and Stacked the Disorient Effect, if he wanted.

Spells inscribed at different levels count as completely different spells and must be sealed to different runes. So if the Runegalder has a 6 SP Flash Grenade and a 11 SP Flash Grenade, he would need two runes to cast both. He couldn’t simply bind “Flash Grenade” to one rune and then choose which he wanted to use in the moment.

SKILL FOCUS (Arcana, 1) Through the course of her career, a Runegalder seeks to further their knowledge of the occult. They receive 1 free purchase of the Arcana Advanced Skill at every other level up.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

The Runegalder uses his body as a prison for latent magical energies which wears on a person over time. He ages at twice the normal rate.

Additionally, the Runegalder's magic is 'dead' and so is less potent than other types of magic, thus allowing some to shrug off their spells.

When shaping a spell, the Runegalder rolls a d20! + 10 + their level. All those that would be affected by the spell roll a d20! + their level. If their total is above the Runegalder's, they're unaffected by his magic. This roll is made regardless of whether or not the person wants to be affected by the spell.

They also find other types of Weirdshaping strange and so are unable to take another Caster Archetype as their Secondary, however, they are able to double down in their Primary.

Runegalder Doubling Down Benefits

VANCIAN CASTING

You can seal a new spell every level.

GRIMOIRE

Your Grimoire starts at 10 Rudiments and new spells have 8 + ( level x 2 ) Drain. You gain 3 Rudiments per level.

SKILL FOCUS

Skill Focus is increased to every level.

SOURCERER

🜂 Advanced Rule

An ethereal being in a physical world, the Sourcerer draws his magic from an internal well within them. As such, they don’t cast spells so much as manifest them into existence. Unlike most other casters, the Sourcerer doesn’t rely on luck or Astral Winds, but instead generates power from within. This is a slower process making Sourcerers less helpful in the moment but more powerful given a bit of time.

VITALITY DIE

d8

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Sourcerers gain the Skills and Masteries of their Secondary Archetype.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

MANIFEST SOURCERY Whether born under a certain constellation or through a long lost bloodline, the Sourcerer has a special connection to the Painted World. They’re a font of magic, making them very powerful and very dangerous.

Drawing from within is consistent but takes time. Every 10 seconds, you add the 10s digit of the number of SP’s in your pool into your SP pool, minimum 1. So, after 50 seconds of manifesting, you would have 15 SPs ( 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 = 15 ).

Sourcerers don’t suffer from normal Fallout and can continue to Manifest for as long as they want, however, this power comes with a price. Being a conduit of the unworldly saps their life and every time they add SPs to their pool, they take damage equal to that pool.

Manifesting requires light concentration so they can do other things while casting spells but if it’s something particularly difficult (like combat or doing mathematics), the Manifesting time is doubled. You can also stop Manifesting at any time but your SP pool will atrophy at the rate of 1 SP per 6 seconds.

POWER OVERWHELMING As the Sourcerer grows, they also grow in power and can stay between two worlds longer. They reduce the amount of damage taken from manifesting by 9 + their level, though they always take at least 1 damage.

TRADITION ATTUNED A Sourcerer is always attuned to a certain Weird Tradition and, at 1st level, knows all Effects from that Tradition and 1 random Rudiment of each type besides that. Starting at 2nd and 11th level, you can choose a second and third Tradition, respectively. At this level and at every other level you obtain, you may select an Effect from that secondary Tradition or roll for another random Rudiment.

DRAGON SKIN A Sourcerer is a well of Weirdcan, therefore, to some exact, absorb Weird that is thrown at them but it comes at a cost. When affected by a spell, the Sourcerer can lower the effect by 1 at 1st level and an additional 1 for every 4 levels they obtain.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Because of Sourcerer is basically a native of another world, their bodies do all they can to shlof off the mortal coil. Every Wound takes 1 day longer to heal

They also find other types of Weirdshaping strange and so are unable to take another Caster Archetype as their Secondary, however, they are able to double down in their Primary.

Sourcerer Doubling Down Benefits

POWER OVERWHELMING

This is increased to 12 + twice your level.

TRADITION ATTUNED

At 1st level you are attuned to 2 Traditions, knowing all the Effects from both. Starting at 2nd level and another time at 8th level and another time at 15th, you can choose another Tradition. At this level and at every level you obtain, you may select an Effect from any available Tradition.

SPEAKER

🜂 Advanced Rule

There is the surface level of things and then there’s how things truly are. By striking the threads of magic, a Speaker is able to touch reality and bend it to her will, changing it as she pleases. The Speaker has a variable amount of Spell Points available to her, giving her some breathing room as well as more flexibility when it comes to casting times.

VITALITY DIE

d4

SKILLS & MASTERIES

A Speaker relies on an academic understanding of magic to augment their natural powers. They receive 1 free purchase of the Lore Skill Suite for free.

Speakers also have a natural talent for languages and gain the Polyglot Mastery for free as well. They quadruple their Lore when determining their starting Language Rank.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

ADAMIC COMMAND To know the First Language is to know the words of the Divines, heard as whispers on the mortal plane. Speakers spend decades learning to correctly pronounce each syllable and its meaning; learning the subtleties that each inflection brings. As they grow in power, the words they speak take on more power.

Once the Speaker decides what their spell will look like (Shape, Origin, Range, and Effect) and what its Drain will be, they roll 343 (note that these dice don’t explode). If the result is higher than the Drain cost, the spell comes into being. The Speaker is free to roll less dice and/or smaller dice, if they so desire.

Speaking words of power takes actually time, specifically 2 seconds per dice rolled.

If 3 - your current Stress Penalty (minimum 1) of the dice you roll come up as 1s, the Speaker has made a major mispronunciation and the GM rolls for a random Effect from a random Tradition but with otherwise identical dimensions to the spell the Speaker wished to cast.

Since Speakers are not channelling astral power like other magic users, the Stress they gain from Fallout is 6 - their level + number of spells cast in the last 24 hours down to a minimum of 1.

DICTION TRAINING As a Speaker gains experience, she becomes more able to get around the trickier parts of the Divine syntax and so can add more force and power to her spells. Every level, she may either add another d3 to her Adamic dice pool or increase the size of one of those dice by 1 (up to a d12).

LEXICON A Speaker starts with 6 random power words or Rudiments to start off and they gain an additional Rudiment every 3rd level. These spells can be from any Tradition.

SKILL FOCUS (special) Through the course of her career, a Speaker seeks to further their knowledge of the occult. They receive 1 free purchase of the Arcana Advanced Skill and 2 free purchases of the Language Advanced Skill at every level up.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Obviously, Speakers can’t have the Stutterer or Mute Flaws. Gaining either of those two Flaws prevents them from casting.

They also find other types of Weirdshaping strange and so are unable to take another Caster Archetype as their Secondary, however, they are able to double down in their Primary.

Speaker Doubling Down Benefits

ADAMIC COMMAND

your starting Adamic dice pool starts at a 4d4s

DICTION TRAINING

You add d4s instead. You can also go up to d20

LEXICON

Increased to 9 starting power words + 1 new one every level

SKILL FOCUS

This is increased to every level

WARLOCK

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Warlock has gone down a dark path and has begun to unlock the innate magic in all living creatures. As such, they tend to be social pariahs because the process of extracting that magic is random and painful. Still all power has a price and Warlocks happily pay it.

VITALITY DIE

d6

SKILLS & MASTERIES

A Warlock relies on an academic understanding of magic to augment their natural powers. They receive 2 free purchases of the Arcana Advanced Skill for free.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

THE BLOOD PACT The Warlock has performed a secret ritual and has joined the Blood Pact. This has two major benefits:

The first is that the Aura Origin has a Drain of 0, instead of 5.

The second is that a Warlock can instantly pull SP from the living creatures around him. This gives him 1 SP per second per person within 10 ft but deals that amount of damage to every person he is pulling from. This includes himself but he also takes an additional damage per second. This blood pull is unaffected by armor but is blocked by other living beings, if they’re closer. Essentially, if a person would give you cover from a ranged attack, they also protect you from the blood pull. Otherwise these SP act exactly like normal and can be instantly used to cast a spell.

This amount is increased by 1 SP and damage per second every 6 levels.

This pull is not stealthy at all as the blood is torn from skin and flies to the Warlock. Additionally, it is not fully controlled and goes on for a minimum of d4! Seconds. A warlock may cast and keep up a spell even when pulling.

In dire times, the Warlock may also pull from his own blood, with each damage he takes giving him double the SPs instead.

SPELL LIST A Warlock gains 6 random Rudiments at 1st level and an additional Rudiment every 3rd level.

SKILL FOCUS (Arcana, 1)Through the course of her career, a Warlock seeks to further their knowledge of the occult. They receive 1 free purchase of the Arcana Advanced Skill at every other level up.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

People don’t like Blood Magic. By most people’s standards, even at its best, it’s dangerous and random and so Warlocks are not well liked. Warlocks are considered 1 level lower on the Racial Preference table for everyone that knows they’re a Warlock.

They also find other types of Weirdshaping strange and so are unable to take another Caster Archetype as their Secondary, however, they are able to double down in their Primary.

Warlock Doubling Down Benefits

THE BLOOD PACT

You now pull blood (and SP) from every person within 20 ft and increases by 1 Damage and SP for every 5 levels.

SPELL LIST

Increased to 9 starting Rudiments + 1 new one every level.

WIZARD

🜂 Advanced Rule

Wizards, make no mistake, are still Wild Magic casters and are no wimps when it comes to raw power, but unlike the Mage that completely gives himself over to the whims of magic, the Wizard uses his study and training to lower the hills and increase the troughs, giving more consistency.

VITALITY DIE

d4

SKILLS & MASTERIES

A Wizard relies on an academic understanding of magic to augment their natural powers. They receive the Arcana Advanced Skill for free.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

WILD MAGIC CASTING The Wizard is able to channel the power of the stars, harnessing it and creating magical energy. While doing so the caster must stand still and he glows with light, being illuminated by a column that reaches above them. This light is equivalent to a candle’s brightness.

After 10 seconds, the Wizard gains d10! Spell Points (SP), which is a single pool that can be spent to shape the Weird on the fly out of any Rudiments he knows. The spell’s Drain is then subtracted from the Wizard’s Spell Point pool when he casts it and at the Interval. As long as he has more Spell Points than Drain, he can keep the spell cast.

Let’s say that you have a spell that is Shaped like a Cone (Drain 3), has a Range of Full (Drain 0), an Origin of Aura (Drain 3) and has a Base Drain of 2 from its Effect. That means the Drain of that spell is 8 ( 3 + 0 + 3 + 2 ).

If it has an Interval of 30 seconds, when you cast that spell, it costs you 8 SP and then, after 30 seconds, it costs you another 8 SP, for a total of 16. As long as you have SPs you can keep a spell active.

You can also suffer weirdburn from keeping a spell up too long: if your spell’s Drain is greater than your current SP, the spell is still cast, but you and everyone within 200 ft takes 1 Stress for every point you’re over.

Going back to the above example of an 8 Drain spell: if you have 20 SP, and you keep the spell up for a minute and a half, you and those within 200 ft take 4 Stress ( 20 - 8 - 8 ). Should you continue to keep the spell up, you’d take an additional 8 Stress every 30 seconds.

It is recommended that even though you don’t technically get those points until after that 10 second duration, that you roll your SP ahead of time and figure out what you’re going to cast ahead of time. The GM is not obliged to stop the count for you if you haven’t been spending those 10 seconds wisely.

This channelling dice increased by 1 for every other level the Wizard has obtained.

You can stop shaping at any time, however, you take Stress equal to the amount of SP you have left - Weird is a powerful primal force and once unleashed, it is not stopped without cost. You also cannot cast or keep up a spell and Channel. This doesn’t remove those SP but the Wizard does lose 1 SP every 6 seconds.

Wild Magic comes with some additional dangers, however. Should the Wizard roll more SPs than 8 + his level, he suffers a Wild Surge but untrained in it, he is unable to use it to the best of his ability.

The spell is recast, however, its Circularly Shaped at Full Range and with an Aura Origin. They also take Stress equal to how much they were over.

IMPROVED ARCANE TRAINING The Wizard is trained as a good student and so takes less time to learn things when it comes to magic. Arcane Trainings are also 4 CrP cheaper for this Archetype and gains a free one every 4 levels.

Additionally, while others can only use their Arcane Training to buff up their spells, the Wizard may use the SP gained from it to lower the number of SPs they receive from channelling, thus having a chance at avoiding a disastrous Wild Surge or at least minimizing the penalty from one.

More on Arcane Training can be found in Chapter 7: Masteries.

WEIRD MEDIUM The Wizard is a bit more impersonal with his relationship with the Weird, preferring to use Weird Mediums as the fulcrum of the Weird around him. At first level, he may choose one from the following list.

Should he find himself without his Weird Medium, he’s in trouble. His threshold for Wild Surges drops to 5 regardless of level.

Weird Mediums List

ANCESTOR BONES

This magic user was gifted the bones of his ancestors, powerful wizards from ages past that are able to give their descendants some of their prowess.

At 1st level, a Wizard with Ancestor Bones as his Weird Medium lowers his channelling time by 1 second. He also lowers it by an additional second for every 5 levels he’s obtained, down to a minimum of 2.

INVESTED ITEM

This Medium comes in many shapes and sizes. By binding her soul to an item, a Wizard can make a metal object an extension of her power.

While holding this item, she may cast any spell with Somatic components as if the hand was free. For armor, the Invested Item offsets the penalty to casting by 1 Drain for every 5 levels the Wizard has obtained. This can only offset the penalty, and never lower it below the base speed. For weapons and other items, they may also cast spells with a Touch Origin on a successful hit, storing one spell indefinitely until it’s used. Needless to say, this a much favored Medium of battle mages.

ORB

These are often called a Seer’s Orb, as this is favored by Wizards of the Occultism Tradition. Orbs are often glass, but those of other materials are not uncommon, though they tend to be precious metals or stones. The only requirement is that they’re larger than your fist. Orbs bend reality, gaining an automatic increase to any spell’s Range by half of its Base Range for every 3 levels of the Wizard.

SPELL BOOK

A large tome, traditionally, the spell book is the favored Medium of the more scholarly magic user.

The Spell Book is not simply incantations jotted down or notes about rituals - it’s an extension of the Wizard’s brain. As long as he’s touching it, he automatically gains the ability to shape using any Rudiment in the book.

Wizards who select this Weird Medium gain 2 extra starting Rudiments, however, these are only stored in their Book. They also gain a new Rudiment every 3 levels, which is also stored there, meaning that if they lose the book, they lose those Rudiments..

SPELL TATTOOS

Painted Men are common in the frozen tundras of Askemark. The metal heavy ink serves to store channeled magic and allows the Wizard to keep invested power for longer.

With Spell Tattoos, the time it takes to lose a SP when not channeling is doubled for every 4 levels the Wizard has obtained. This also lowers the Stress taken from stopping a spell with SP left by 1 per every 3 levels.

STAVE

Traditionally made of holly wood harvested with a silver sickle at midnight on the night of the new moon, Staves serve as extensions of the Wizard’s soul, much like an Invested Item, but because it’s not made of metal, it holds different properties.

While welding a Stave in one hand, the Wizard offsets the Fallout from casting a spell by 1 every 3 levels the Wizard has obtained. This can't lower it below 0, however, but does extend to the people within 50 ft of them as well.

FAMILIAR

Favored by the traveling Wizard, a familiar is a small animal or homunculus that is bonded to the Wizard’s soul. Because of this connection, a wizard can see and hear through their Familiar’s eyes and ears as well as channel SP through it, as long as it is standing still, allowing the Wizard full movement even when channeling.

Familiars are small sized creatures. The player selects three candidates, but the GM makes the final decision on which creature came when she called, unless the Wizard opts to have built herself a homunculus.

A Wizard who would get 2 Weird Mediums but chooses familiar twice may select a medium or large sized creature or any small sized creature of her choice.

WAND

The Wand is an exact tool, a tool of precision. It is favored by more aggressive spell casters because it makes their spells hard to resist.

While casting with a Wand, the Wizard gains a free Stack of one of the spell’s Effect Rudiments for every 3 levels they’ve obtained.

SPELL LIST A Wizard gains 8 random Rudiments at 1st level and an additional Rudiment every 3rd level.

SKILL FOCUS (Arcana, 1) Through the course of her career, a Wizard seeks to further their knowledge of the occult. They receive 1 free purchase of the Arcana Advanced Skill at every other level up.

SKILL ADEPT This character has a knack for skills. All Advanced Skills have their cost reduced by 1 CrP. They also gain a 10% discount to all Skill Suites. This stacks with other Skill Adepts.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

The Wizard’s study can sometimes leave her with a divorced relationship to reality that can make them somewhat obtuse. When bringing in Traits, Wizards reroll their highest dice roll.

They also find other types of Weirdshaping strange and so are unable to take another Caster Archetype as their Secondary, however, they are able to double down in their Primary.

Wizard Doubling Down Benefits

WILD MAGIC CASTING

Channeling dice is increased to d20! and increases every level. Wild Magic threshold becomes 9 + ( level x 3 ).

WEIRD MEDIUM

You get two and need to lose both before suffering penalties.

IMPROVED ARCANE TRAINING

Increases to every other level.

SPELL LIST

Increase to 10 starting Rudiments + 1 new Rudiment every level.

SKILL FOCUS

This is increased to every level

Servant Archetypes represent those that have devoted themselves to higher causes, lifting their eyes from the Middle Realm to a more pure order, whether that’s the Divines, the Ancestral Spirits, or the Bones of Ymir.

Servant Archetypes play the best with others, often modifying the other Archetype’s powers with Divine assistance.

ASHCALLER

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Ashcaller is a divine elementalist, with a larger selection of Miracles than you average priest but they’re not pulled from the traditional Miracle list.

VITALITY DIE

d6

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Ashcallers receive 2 purchases of the Religion (Ancestors) Advanced Skill for free.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

ANCESTOR COVENANT The Ashcaller is able to call upon the Honorable Dead to effect change in the Middle Realm. They may use any spell from the Animism, Calling, and Occultism Traditions with their Honor Dice from Favor behaving like a Channelling Dice. They have access to all other Rudiments and may spend Favor normally to modify their surroundings as well.

TONGUE OF THE DEAD Whenever an Ashcaller invokes a Miracle and any of the Honor Dice explode, the next Miracle's invocation gives them an additional free Honor Dice. This bonus doesn’t stack if multiple dice explode.

HONORING AND HONORED The Ancestors smile on those that strength their legacy. Whenever an Ashcaller gains Honor, they gain an equivalent amount of Favor. This can put them over their Max Favor.

ETERNAL FAVOR An Ashcaller is loved for their devotion to their Ancestors beyond others. They add their level to their Max Favor.

CATECHISM By reading the embers and smoke of their holy fires, the Ashcaller is about to discern the will of his Ancestors and better understand the Higher Realms. They receive a free purchase of the Religion (Ancestors) Advanced Skill at 1st level and at every level up.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Ashcallers have turned their back on the Divines and so are unable to invoke Miracles that are not directly related to their Covenant.

Because of their Anointing, they're also unable to take another Servant Archetype as a Secondary, nor are they allowed to double down in this one.

CONCERT

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Concert is a people’s person in the deepest sense. They help others be their best self, buffing others by linking their souls together.

VITALITY DIE

d4

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Receive double the Skill & Masteries of your Secondary Archetype. Replace any instances of “or” with “and”

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

CONDUIT OF THE SOUL The Concert is a vessel for the divine in all living things. They add their level to their Max Favor.

SOUL UNITED The Concert, by using the links between people, is able to strengthen themselves and others.

A person is considered Soul Linked if the Concert has a Devotion that includes a person or vice versa. This can be met with a general Devotion.

If they met both conditions (both have a Devotion to each other), they’re considered Soul Fettered. This doesn’t count if both have a general Devotion to one another: at least one Devotion has to be specific to either the Concert or the other person.

ONE BEING Any Miracle is considered in her Covenant when invoked on someone the Concert is Soul Linked to.

On top of this, if it is someone they’re Soul Fettered with, she gains half the Favor (rounded down) spent this way back.

WE'RE ALL FRIENDS The Concert has a unique ability to just chill everyone out and get them to relax, even around age old enemies. If someone who she is Soul Linked with is about to be attacked by a sentient foe, before the first blow is actually thrown, the Concert can spend 5 Favor to initiate a Conflict to get both sides to back down.

If it is someone she is Soul Fettered to, she may do this for only 3 Favor.

MUSE The Concert inspires others to rise to the challenge just solely based on her strong belief in them. When starting a Conflict, Combat, or Skill Challenge, the Concert receives 2 uses of her Honor Dice that she may give to anyone she is Soul Linked to.

If they are Soul Fettered, that person receives the max value of the dice when they redeem them.

She gains an additional Honor Die for every level she’s obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

A Concert’s being is linked to others and so their fates are entwined. If someone who is Soul Linked to the Concert dies, they gain 20 Stress each time.

However, if someone they are Soul Fettered with dies, they gain no extra Vitality and no Vitality Die roll on level up. If more than one dies, that subtract 1 for each person from their Max Vitality.

Because of their Anointing, they're also unable to take another Servant Archetype as a Secondary, nor are they allowed to double down in this one.

PARAGON ACOLYTE

🜂 Advanced Rule

These people take hero worship to another level and by emulating their idols, they convince the already shaky reality that they’re the reincarnation of said hero, giving them amazing powers.

VITALITY DIE

d8

SKILLS & MASTERIES

The Paragon Acolyte receives a free purchase of 1 Skill Suite relating to his hero’s story.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

PARAGON’S LEGACY The Paragon Acolyte can channel his hero, allowing him to recreate events from their life on a smaller scale. The player selects 5 feats that the hero performed during their lifetime and, whenever they invoke Miracles related to one or more of those feats, they increase the Honor Dice they get from Favor by 1 size. It is increased an additional size for every 4 levels the Paragon Acolyte has obtained.

LIKE STORIES OF OLD Feeling the power of the old stories rush through your veins, it allows you to soar higher than mortals dare. Whenever you roll the maximum amount on their Honor Dice, you gain another use of your Honor Die.

MANIFEST DESTINY Fate is always on the side of the hero, then and now. By spending a point of Favor, you can turn one of your Conflict, Skill Check, or Defence die to its maximum size. You can do this once at first level and an additional time every 2 levels.

MANTLE HERO At the end of each day, the Paragon Acolyte receives 1 Favor for every 10 points of Fame they have, minimum 1, but does not gain Favor by Holy Days or Sacrifices.

GREATER BEING Linked to their hero’s spirit, they can increase the amount of Favor they can get. Their Max Favor is their Honor Category + their level.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Every hero has a weakness that can lead to their downfall. During character creation, the Paragon Acolyte tells the story of the hero’s downfall. When it becomes relevant, the Paragon Acolyte cannot spend Honor or Honor Dice to help him.

Because of their Anointing, they're also unable to take another Servant Archetype as a Secondary, nor are they allowed to double down in this one.

PRIEST

Priests focus on casting Miracles on other people rather than themselves, making them a good support Archetype for other classes. Their Miracles vary widely based on their patron Divine.

VITALITY DIE

d6

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Priests receives 3 purchases of the Religion (The Priest’s Covenant) Advanced Skill for free

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

DIVINE COVENANT During Character Creation, a Priest selects 1 Covenant and 1 Cosmic Link, representing their diety’s sphere of influence and personality, respectively.

Covenants change which Miracles the Priest has access to while Cosmic Links change the ways you gain and spend Favor.

SHEPHERD OF THE PEOPLEIf someone else prays for a Miracle within sight of the Priest, the Priest can spend his own Favor to increase the effective cost of that Miracle. This ability doesn’t work on those Anointed into other cults. He gains half, rounded down, of the Favor spent this way back.

FAVORED OF THE DIVINES The Priest’s mission isn’t a selfish one, but it does have some benefits and they’re loved for their devotion to their Divines beyond others. They add their level to their Max Favor.

CATECHISM By studying the holy texts, the Priest is about to discern the will of the Divines and better understand the Higher Realms. They receive a free purchase of the Religion (Divines) Advanced Skill at first level and at every level up.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

A Priest has sworn themselves to a Higher Power and as a token of their Covenant, they must select a taboo; an action or thing they must never do, such as cut their hair or eat meat. This must be appropriate to the Divine and be approved by the GM before play begins.

Because of their Anointing, they're also unable to take another Servant Archetype as a Secondary, nor are they allowed to double down in this one.

SHAMAN

🜂 Advanced Rule

A Shaman is one who’s invested their second soul into a Bonfire, thus they carry a part of the flame with them where they go. Because of this, others can link into their power and stand on hallowed ground where ever they go.

VITALITY DIE

d8

SKILLS & MASTERIES

They have been to the womb of creation and back, they gain one free purchase of the Lore Skill Suite.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

LINKED TO THE BONFIRE The Shaman has the soul of the Bonfire and so is a generator of holy power that flows from them. They increase their Max Favor by their level.

They’re considered part of the Nature, Fire, Fate, and Honor Covenant.

MANTLE of FIRE The Shaman’s power projects out from him so that call can feel it. This is an aura of light that starts out projecting 5 ft form him and is increased by 5 ft for every 5 levels they’ve obtained.

He may temporarily increase the radius using Favor, with 1 Favor expanding it by 5 ft though this only lasts 15 seconds.

BURNING GROUND Wherever a Shaman walks is holy ground and those that have no respect for him, find themselves on shaky footing. Enemies within the Shaman’s Mantle of Fire reduce their Knock-Back Threshold by 5. This is increased by 5 for every 5 levels the Shaman has obtained.

WELCOMING HEARTH Those close to the Shaman, both physically and emotionally, find that they too are gifted with the gift of fire. Any friendly person standing with the Shaman’s Mantle of Fire also gains the benefits of any Miracle currently affecting the Shaman but only when they stand within the Mantle.

SACRIFICE of SOUL The Shaman can remove their mortal coil to manifest their true nature but doing so may kill them. For every 2 Vitality the Shaman sacrifices, they gain 1 temporary special Favor. This Favor doesn’t count towards your Current Favor and only the Cost when invoking a Miracle. All damage dealt this way goes on one Wound and the Favor is wasted if not used before the next sun rise.

The Shaman may also use this extra Favor to expand his Mantle of Fire.

WARMING SOUL The Shaman warms the souls of others like the fire warms the body. Those around the Shaman heal an additional Stress after a day of travel together. This is increased by 1 for every 2 levels the Shaman’s obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

The Shaman literally glows with inner light, giving enemies a +10 to spot them.

Because of their Anointing, they're also unable to take another Servant Archetype as a Secondary, nor are they allowed to double down in this one.

Additionally, when they invoke a Miracle, the Bonfire swells within them, making 10 ft around them Bright Illumination. The Shaman is penalized as well if they don’t close their eyes, though there’s no permanent damage.

SYMBOLIST

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Symbolist is the word and the law, both being sacred to him. His worships reality itself and channels the innate power in the corpse of Ymir to shun magic and miracles. He grips the law so tightly as to bend it to his will.

VITALITY DIE

d10

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Being attuned to the beat of the world, Symbolists receive one free purchase of the Survival Skill Suite.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

LINKED TO THE BONES OF YMIR Harnessing the divine energies of the Middle Realm, the Symbolist is able to become a part of the world in a more real way. He gains Favor equal to his Honor Category + 1/2 his level. Unlike other Servants, he can’t gain additional Favor through the normal means (sacrifices and holy days): this Favor is static and only increases with level.

MARKS of the EARTH Through ceremony and ritual, the Symbolist is able to invoke Miracles that are normally reserved only for the Divines. Given an hour, the Symbolist can endow a mark on him or another person. During the ceremony, he selects a certain number of his Favor and “locks” into the mark.

Doing so essentially invokes a Miracle on that person, however, unlike a normal Miracle, it persists for as long as the person marked wishes it and there is a distinct chance of failure: the Symbolist must roll over 10 on their Honor Dice. He gains an additional roll of the Honor Dice for every Favor he locks in.

If the Miracle is unsuccessfully invoked at the end of the ceremony, the mark, and the Miracle by extension, didn’t take and that Favor is freed once more, however, the Symbolist can’t try the ceremony again on that person until they increase an Honor Category.

If it was, that Miracle active, blessing the Symbolist and/or marked person. The mark can only be removed at the will of the person or Symbolist and can’t be removed by normal means (so washing won’t get rid of it). The Favor is “locked” and can't be used for other marks and Miracles until released.

Unlike normal, the Miracle doesn’t give the full Honor Dice as a bonus whenever the Miracle is applicable: instead the person gains a +1 (or -1 depending on what the person wants when they roll) for each Favor locked into that Miracle when applicable.

Like normal Miracles, however, this can modify things you normally couldn’t, like Movement speed or Knock-Back, or what-have-you. The GM may also increase this bonus if he feels it is appropriate (getting a +1 to your equipment breaking isn’t that big of a deal so increasing it to +3 wouldn’t be out of place, for example).

Should the Symbolist die, all his marks are released. Also, should the Symbolist’s Favor drop below their currently locked Favor (from lowering an Honor Category, for example) they’re forced to unlock one of their marks and dispel a Miracle.

LAW of AVERAGES The Symbolist is a pillar of certainty in a sea of chaos. If the Symbolist rolled under the average on a dice, he may gain 5 Stress and the next roll someone makes gives them a +1 bonus to their roll. Additionally, if he rolled over the average, he may spend 5 Stress for the next roll to be at a -1 penalty.

This bonus is also increased by 1 for every 2 levels they’ve obtained and can negate perfect attacks and defenses.

CONDUIT OF REALITY The Symbolist can invoke Miracles from the following Covenants: Dream, Guardians, Adversity, Battle, Beauty, Fate, Fire, Home, Honor. He is unable to invoke any Miracles outside of these Covenants, even for the normal price.

PRIMARY BOON

EXPERT Law of Averages is increased to every other level and Honor Category + 1/2 level

CASTER Symbolists can't select a Caster Archetype as their Secondary

SERVANT Symbolists can’t select another Servant Archetype as their Secondary.

SOCIALITE Law of Averages is increased to every other level and Honor Category + 1/2 level

FIGHTER Law of Averages is increased to every other level and Honor Category + 1/2 level

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

By anchoring themselves to the Bones of Ymir, the Symbolist cuts off his connection to the God’s Realm in a way: other Servants are unable to invoke beneficial Miracles on him and they also increase their Honor Dice by 1 size when invoking destructive Miracles on him.

Because of their Anointing, they're also unable to take another Servant Archetype as a Secondary, nor are they allowed to double down in this one. Also, due to their inheritant link with Ymir, they're unable to take a Caster Archetype as their Secondary.

Socialite Archetypes are people people. They seem to get a real kick out of interacting with other; especially if it ends with them getting their way. While other's first weapons are sword, a Socialite's first weapon is their charm.

Unsurprisingly, Socialite Archetypes tend to rely on Intellect and Charisma.

ADVOCATE

While other Socialites like the limelight, the Advocate doesn’t mind playing second fiddle and in fact, thrives there. When supporting others in a Social Conflict, the Advocates gets a lot of bonuses.

VITALITY DIE

d4

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Advocates gain 1 free purchase of the Lore Skill Suite.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

RETHINK AN ARGUMENT Advocates tend to be more introspective than other Socialites, which allows them to wait on an argument until they can articulate their thoughts more clearly. When making an Appeal, the Advocate can put aside a number of dice that they rolled a 1 on equal to 3 + their level.

They can later bring it back in, adding it to another round’s total with a +2 for every round that dice has sat out. This can bring the total over the dice's maximum value. If you win that round, you also put dice added this way into the winning pool, if applicable.

FLANKING POINT The Advocate can really use his unassuming nature to really hammer home a point. If multiple pieces of Evidence is presented in a round of a Conflict, and the opposition picks yours to respond to, you gain an additional point.

WALLFLOWER BLOOM The Advocate really shines when not center stage. When making an Appeal, if you roll the least amount of dice (or are tied for it) and your side wins the round, gain an additional point.

HELPER'S PORTION Sometimes the reward is just to know you've helped. When the person that started the Conflict is dividing out the Honor, if the Advocate takes the least amount, they gain 1 Honor + 1 for every 5 levels they've obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Advocates can kind of lock up when they’re in the driver's seat. When they’re the only one in a Social Conflict, Evidence and Appeals give them 1 less point.

ARMIGER

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Armiger is one that has been granted the right to bear a cost of arms, either their personal sigil or their liege lord. People are naturally drawn to these individuals and they find their strength in the support of this crowd.

VITALITY DIE

d8

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Armigers receive 1 free purchase of the Tactics Skill Suite

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

RISING THE BANNER Armigers attract the best and brightest to their banner. As such, they gain double the bonus to attracting followers from Honor. On top of this, they only gain the -5 to their roll for every other followers they attract.

FORCE OF PERSONALITY No matter the situation, Armigers are able to leverage their likeable personalities. When Rallying a broken person, they may gain another use of their Honor Die and an additional Honor Dice for every 2 levels. This additional use of the Honor Dice lasts until the end of the Conflict and doesn’t need to be spent right then.

STANDARD An Armiger has the right to bear a heraldic crest that identifies him. He may emblazon this on a banner or his shield, but by having it proudly displayed, while he is still fighting, all his allies use his Honor category to determine their starting Morale category.

SKILL FOCUS (Tactics, 4) At first level and every level up, Armigers receive 4 free skill purchases. These can be distributed between any Advanced Skills from the Tactics Skill Suite. These free purchases may not be doubled up on in the same level but are applied after Skills have been bought by the Character.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Armigers are standards of the people and when they fail to live up to that, they’re judged more harshly. If the Armiger is forced to retreat from a Combat or Conflict for any reason, they lose 5 Honor.

CHAMPION

🜂 Advanced Rule

A crusader for a cause, paladin of the king, a knight errant questing for his love. These are Champions. Their oaths and devotions are the weapons they wield and, from sacrifice to a cause greater than themselves, strength.

VITALITY DIE

d10

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Champions receive 1 free purchase of the Tactics Skill Suites.

Champions gain Armor Basic Training (Heavy), Shield Basic Training and 1 free Weapon Basic Training.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

POWER OF DEVOTION Zeal is a powerful force and can sharpen the mind and bring out the best in someone when properly channelled. Whenever redeeming an Honor Die while doing something related to their Devotion, they also add that Devotion to the roll.

FANATICAL PRESENCE Your oath is sacred and only death can prevent you from the fulfilment of your duty and others can see that. This total faith in your path makes the going easier for others.

During a Morale Conflict that relates to the Champion’s Devotion, whenever an argument involves him, one of those dice gets a +1. This is increased by 1 for every level you’ve obtained.

Multiple Devotions don’t stack in this case. You may add this bonus regardless of whether or not you're the party captain and anyone on the Champion’s side is eligible for this benefit.

SOLEMNITY OF CAUSE A Champion considers his obligations with a solemn contemplation and as his beliefs are challenged, the stronger they grow. If he rolls at least two 1s on his Repercussions from a Social Conflict where one of his Devotions was involved, he may increase the size of one of that Devotion for free in addition to his other choice of benefit.

IRON RESOLVE Nothing, not even apparent defeat, can sway a Champion from their course of action. In a Conflict that is related to at least one of their Devotions, when the Champion loses an Appeal, they gain a +1 to their next round if they Appeal again. This is increased by 1 for every 3 levels they've obtained. they

Those on his side are also bolstered by this surety and gain the same bonus if the Champion gets it.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Champions take their oaths very seriously and don’t take new ones on lightly. When rolling Repercussions, a Champion may only choose “Gain a Devotion” if he rolled a number of 1s greater than or equal to the number of Devotion he already has.

Anytime they can purchase Devotions for CrP, the price of a new Devotion is 10 CrP x the number of Devotions the Champion already has.

DIPLOMAT

The Diplomat is a strong willed character that makes the most of emotional Appeals: learning how to use them to great effect to sway his opponents.

VITALITY DIE

d4

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Diplomats receive 1 free purchase of the Streetwise Skill Suite

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

CAREFUL WORDING A Diplomat has the grace and tact to be able to reword an argument in the most effective way possible. The Diplomat can spend 10 Stress to reroll all of the dice for one side when they Appeal in a Social Conflict. For his and his allies’ Characteristics, take the higher of the two results. For the enemy, take the lower of the two results.

STRONG PERSONALITY As a Diplomat grows, she becomes more confident in who she is and what she wants. At 2nd level and every other level after that, a Diplomat can increase the strength of one of their Traits by 1 dice (up to a d20) or they save them and cash in two of these increases for a new weak Trait starting at 1d4.

GREY EMINENCE In his arena, he is king and nothing can shake him. For the duration of a Conflict the Diplomat gains 1 free use of their Honor Die. They gain an additional free Honor Die for every level they’ve obtained. They can only apply 1 of these bonus Honor Dice to a single roll, though that doesn’t stop them adding Honor Dice that they got from other sources.

RESILIENT CHARACTER Surprisingly, those with the strongest personalities have the greatest power to resist abuse and not second guess themselves. When using an Appeal, shrink the Repercussion Dice by 1 size.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Diplomats put their reputation on the table whenever they engage in Social Conflict. They lose 5 Honor whenever they lose a Conflict.

FOIL

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Foil focuses on using the other person when convincing them of something. He can steal the opponent’s dice in Social Conflict and when things get tough, he can tag in another person to take on the Conflict.

VITALITY DIE

d4

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Foils receive 1 free purchase of the Streetwise Skill Suite

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

MIRRORING By agreeing with your enemy, you can sometimes lull them into a false sense of security, causing them to lower their guard. A Foil can take 15 Stress and make a guess at a Characteristic his opponent has. If he’s correct, that Characteristic loses 1 dice for every 2 levels he’s obtained, down to 1 dice. He also automatically receives points equal to the dice removed.

So a level 7 Foil who correctly guesses a 3d6! characteristic, lowers it to d6! and gains 2 points.

GASLIGHTING A Foil’s particularly devious when it comes to other’s flaws and weaknesses. A Foil can guess a character’s Mental or Behavioral Flaw. If correct, and they successfully use it in an Appeal, they gain an additional point.

CONTEMPT A Foil can pretend he doesn't care, thus shaking his opponent's confidence in their arguments. If a Foil starts the round, Appeals, and loses, they can take 10 Stress. If they do, they gain half the points they would have gotten if they has succeeded. They reduce the Stress inflicted by 1 for every 4 levels they've obtained.

SHIFT BLAME There’s strength in numbers, especially when those numbers are used as a shield. When his side makes a successful Appeal, the Foil can sacrifice 1 Honor to choose who’s dice gets added as points instead of going with the lowest. That person, however, is thrown head first into a stressful situation, suddenly becoming the center of attention, giving them 3 Stress for every point of difference between what they’re added and what would have been added. This penalty is lowered by 1 Stress for every 10 levels the Foil has obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Foils are so good at mirroring others that they often forget to reflect on themselves. They only gain positive benefits from social Repercussions if they roll two natural 1s.

FUSILIER

🜂 Advanced Rule

Firearms are new and exciting but also dangerous. While not as damaging or as far reaching as other ranged weapons, they do terrify in a primal way, a thing that Fusiliers have learned to exploit.

VITALITY DIE

d6

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Fusiliers receive 1 free purchase of the Tactics Skill Suite and 1 free Weapon Basic Training for the firearm of their choice.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

STANDARD ISSUE Fusiliers often tend to gain their firearms from the military and a lot of time, they take them home (much to the chagrin of the quartermasters). They may start the game with 4 handgonnes, 10 fire lances, or a hakenbuchse.

OF LEAD & POWDER A Fusilier trains with guns, pushing their skills to the limit, allowing to get creative in their uses. Fusiliers may wield and fire handgonnes with one hand and count as small weapons for the 2 1 Handed Weapons Style. They’re also able to deploy a hakenbuchse’s trip pod in 2 seconds instead of 5 seconds and they get 2 uses out of each fire lance.

With all firearms, a Fusilier can light the brand in a swift motion, taking no time at all, lowering the firing time by 4 seconds.

ROAR OF THE BEAST There’s something terrifying of the smell of smoke and the rage of fire and a Fusilier knows how to use this to their advantage. If in a Morale Conflict, enemies that are Appealing to those flinching gain an extra 2d6!.

Further, those that travel with the Fusilier gain an immunity to this after a combat. They may by the Born Gunner Mastery for half cost (rounded down).

He has also grown accustomed to the roar of the cannon and so it immune to flinching from firearms.

Roar of the Beast Lite

If you’re not running the Morale rules, here is another option to not have the Fusilier nerfed because of this change:

The Fusilier can select a number of flinched enemies up to his Warfare Skill Rank to gain an additional -2 to their Defense for each Wound Category they've dropped.

BOOMSTICK By adding just a little something to the powder mix, the Fusilier can make that bang from the firearm going off exceptionally loud. The minimum amount of time an enemy flinches from a Fusilier’s firearm going off increases by 1 for every 2 levels they’ve obtained.

MARTIAL TRAINING A Fusilier receives a Tier 1 Weapon Advanced Training in the Firearm of his choice for every level he’s obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Due to all the gunfire a Fusilier has been around, they have a harder time hearing than others. The Listening Advanced Skill costs 6 CrP instead of 4.

KNAVE

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Knave is a mean villain - mean in the sense of being crude and villian in the sense of being low class, but unlike others, the Knave doesn’t seem to mind and that’s where their strength lies.

VITALITY DIE

d6

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Knaves receive no free skills

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

UNIMPRESSED A Knave knows that silly titles are only there to buttress insecurities. Others gain no benefit from their Fame, Honor, and/or Stat Social Dice when engaging in Social Conflict with the Knave.

PLAYING DIRTY While others hoard their precious Honor for the sake of not having people talk bad about them, the Knave doesn’t care and so she can use her as a weapon. A Knave can lose 3 Honor to increase all her Characteristic dice by 1 and reroll all non-exploded dice she’s using in her Appeal that round. She can also increase 1 extra dice by 1 size for every 2 levels she’s obtained.

FOOL’S BEARING By deflating yourself, you can deflate others. Each round, a Knave can pay X Honor or X points to lower all non-Flaw Characteristic dice by X sizes for everyone in that round (including the Knave and her allies). This follows the normal rules if a Characteristic would drop below a d4!, however, the Knave’s never drop below 1d4!.

This ability shrinks a single dice an additional size for every 2 levels she’s obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Knaves aren’t really heroes at the end of the day, even if they try to be. Shrink their Honor Dice by 1 size.

MONTEBACK

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Monteback is one of tricks and quick thinking. He relies on dazing the person with words, hoping they won’t take the time to catch onto his tricks.

VITALITY DIE

d4

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Montebacks receive 1 free purchase of the Streetwise Skill Suite

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

FAST TALKER If you can get someone to agree quickly, so much the better. You start the Conflict gaining an additional d8! but shrinks one size each round, down to a d4!. You gain an additional dice for every 2 levels you've obtained. You only get this bonus if you choose to Appeal that round. The dice shrinks even if you use Evidence that round.

However, if you’re unable to convince your target by that time, the next round you receive no bonus dice from this ability and each round after, you instead reduce the size of one of your dice if you Appeal.

JACK OF ALL TRADES You don’t have to know everything but you should act like you do. The Monteback has mastered that art and so they increase the dice they gain from their Skills by 1 size.

KEEP 'EM OFF BALANCE The Monteback knows how to make a mark sweat and uses that pressure to have them start making rash decisions in his favor. If your opponents gain a Repercussion dice, they roll it instantly. They gain the Stress immediately though Long Term Repercussions are still held till after the Conflict.

SKILL FOCUS (Streetwise, 4) At first level and every level up, Montebacks receive 4 free skill purchases. These can be distributed between any Advanced Skills from the Streetwise Skill Suite. These free purchases may not be doubled up on in the same level but are applied after Skills have been bought by the Character.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

The Monteback is the devil in disguise and his untrustworthy nature makes him never quite sure if you can trust him. You lower everyone’s Racial Preference towards you by 1, bottoming out at Hate.

NOBLE

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Noble is typically aloof and hard to impress and so can convince people simply by making them unsure about their conviction, shrinking their dice in Social Conflict.

VITALITY DIE

d4

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Nobles receive 1 free purchase of the Tactics Skill Suite

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

NOBLE BEARING By reminding others of their lower station in life, you can remind them just how petty their needs are. You inflict 1 point of Stress for every Characteristic your opponent(s) brings in each round upto your level, rounded up.

RETHINK YOUR WORDS Assail the throne of a noble’s grace with caution, for you are at his will and pleasure. Whenever the Noble, or one of his allies, wins an Appeal, you may force the enemy to reroll one of their dice on their next Appeal.

ROYAL BACKGROUND Nobles form an elite class of society, giving them a strong sense of self and confidence. Their Devotion to their clan starts at a 1d10! and they gain the Trait “Noble Heritage” at 3d6! for free. This doesn't replace any of their 6 free Traits and may be increased in the normal matter.

GOOD BREEDING In victory or defeat, the Noble is gracious. At the end of a Conflict, the Noble receives 1 Honor automatically. This bonus is increased by 1 Honor for every 2 levels he’s obtained.

All his allies also automatically gain 1 Honor, though this doesn’t increase as the Noble levels.

INHERITANCE This character may have had an extra leg up in life, allowing them the opportunity to start with better equipment than others. They gain a free weapon of their choice or a Courser mount and also gain 15 sc for each CrP cashed in at the end of Character Creation.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Noblity is a collective illusion and so those of royal blood, no matter how limited strive to keep that illusion in place. Nobles lose 1 Honor and gain 1 Stress whenever they're not referred to by either their proper title, "my lord", or "sir".

OFFICER

🜂 Advanced Rule

The cunning Officer is able to read a battlefield like a book and with a single command, swings the fulcrum of battle in her side’s favor. He is the party leader and the standard to which others flock.

VITALITY DIE

d6

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Officers receive 1 free purchase of the Tactics Skill Suite.

Officers receive the Armor Basic Training (Light)

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

MOMENTUM Those in leadership can often turn a small victory into a large one. Whenever the Officer wins a round, they gain a bonus d6! the next round for each successive time they’ve done so.

ESPRIT de CORPS The Officer can push others to limits they didn’t know they had in them to fight for their comrades. At first level, while the Officer is conscious, any ally that can see him gains a positive Devotion to the company starting at strength 1. This is increased by 1 for every level he’s obtained.

BATTLEFIELD MANEUVERING Careful planning and strategic movement can help win over the day. The Officer can sacrifice an Honor Die to allow anyone on the battlefield to either switch Tactics or Shift without a penalty at that second. This can be done after a roll is made and the results given and the Officer can either sacrifice his Honor Die or one that the person who is benefiting from this ability has.

MARTIAL TRAINING An Officer receives her choice of a free Tier 2 Armor, Shield, or Weapon Advanced Training for every 2 levels she’s obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Officers don’t really know how to fight alone and may take the better part of valor in a combat. When fighting alone, Officer characters gain 1 Stress everytime they put up dice in a Morale Conflict.

PHILOSOPHER

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Philosopher reserves his strength, allowing his opponent in a Conflict to escalate for him. While others suffer strain from not meeting the argument straight on, the Philosopher uses it to his advantage.

VITALITY DIE

d4

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Philosophers receive 1 free purchase of the Lore Skill Suite.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

RHETORIC By knowing the fundamentals of how to form an argument, a Philosopher can stop and point out the logical fallacies in another’s argument (even if they’re not there). A Philosopher can flip a dice over one side, to a lower number. They can flip an additional dice for every level they’ve obtained.

So, they can move a 7 on a d10 to 5, 3, 2, but not 10, or a 6 on a d12 to a 2 or 3 but not up to 8, 9, or 12.

STOIC Philosophers are trained so that petty things like emotion arguments don’t have as strong an effect on them and their opponent can tell. If a Philosopher uses Evidence against an opponent's Appeal or his opponent Appeals and he responds with Evidence, he gains 1 point.

CLOSING REMARKS Regardless of whether they want to hear it or not, the Philosopher knows how to make you listen. Whenever a Philosopher pushes, he gains 1 point.

PRACTICE DEBATE Even if you don’t get what you want, you can often get practice for next time. Whenever a Philosopher loses a Social Conflict, they gain 1 use of their Honor Die in their next Conflict. This increases by 1 use for every other level they obtain, however, they can’t use more than 1 per round.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

The Philosopher tries to not let things get personal: when they make an Appeal, increase their Repercussions dice by 1 size.

RASCAL

The Rascal gains a few skills but their main strength is their cunning ability to avert danger, though any brush with death leaves him shaken. On top of this, in Social Conflict, the Rascal wins because he can leverage circumstances in his favor.

VITALITY DIE

d6

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Rascals receive 1 free purchase of the Trades Skill Suite

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

LUCKY The Rascal is naturally blessed with the ability to get out of trouble and use that adrenaline that comes as death comes near to dodge the grim reaper and keep running. After the results are given, the Rascal can take 2 Stress to modify his results by 1. These may be done with the following conditions:

  • They can never be used to make you a better fighter. Stress gained this way can only be used to dodge death or escape a bad situation but never to make your character a superman.
  • The character must think of a situation that saves his rear end, something that happens to him that’s to his advantage.

The key here is that it can’t be impossible but it can be highly improbable. The chandelier rope breaking right at that moment separating him from a blood thirsty guard, a pigeon flying across an archer’s view intercepting an arrow, etc. are all acceptable.

It can’t be the result of skill. Him deflecting the blade with his hand like a badass is right out.

Should the character be unable to think of a scenario that fits both of these criteria, he’s unable to gain Stress to save himself.

GREASE PAINT & GLITTER If there's one thing that a Rascal knows, it’s how to position themselves in the most advantageous light. In a Conflict, once per round, the Rascal increases one dice 1 size. This is increased to by 1 for every level he’s obtained. This can either be his or his allies’, it doesn’t matter.

Once he’s increased all dice in a round 1 size, he may then go back and increase them again, and so on.

SKILL FOCUS (Any, 2) At first level and every level other up, Rascals receive 2 free skill purchases. These can be distributed between any Advanced Skill. These free purchases may not be doubled up on in the same level but are applied after Skills have been bought by the Character.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

A Rascal favors no weapons as they tend to get you killed: all Weapon Advanced Trainings are 2 CrP more expensive per Tier (Tier 1: 10 CrP, Tier 3: 22 CrP).

War is a ladder by which capable people are able to climb the ranks of society. Fighter Archetypes focus on combat and battle, either by training and discipline or by out maneuvering their opponent.

Unsurprisingly, these Archetypes focus on Constitution, but how you approach combat may decide whether you favor Strength, Dexterity, or even Intellect or Wisdom.

BARBARIAN

🜂 Advanced Rule

“Barbarian” is often a derogatory term used by people who consider themselves civilized but the truth is that the Barbarian is a title of honor. The Barbarian is a survivor and survives on wit, rather than raw power.

VITALITY DIE

d10

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Barbarians receive 1 free purchase of the Survival Skill Suites.

Barbarians also gain Armor Basic Training (Light) and 3 Weapon Basic Trainings, 1 for a 2 handed weapon, a ranged weapon, and small weapon

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

ADVANCED TACTICS A Barbarian is a skirmisher and doesn’t rely on formalized training methods like other fighters. As such, their greatest strength is the utilization of Tactics. At 1st level and at every 2nd level after that, a Barbarian can increase the bonus or lower the penalty for a Tactic by 1, though they can never make a penalty a bonus nor go beyond double a bonus’s original amount. So, the max you can get the Faint to is +10 to Attack and +0 to your Defense.

This doesn't remove requirements (such as moving) or special penalties (such as dealing half damaged while Feinting against people who Step Back or Retreat).

TRIBAL WEAPONRY Trained from birth with tribal weapons, the Barbarian thinks of disparate weapons all as extensions of his arm. At 1st level, the Barbarian picks a 2 handed weapon, a ranged weapon, and a small weapon. All these weapons are considered 1 group: any Mastery purchased for one of them is applied to every other weapon. They’re considered Tier 2 for price.

CONSTANT VIGILANCE Pay attention or end up as monster chow. Everyone receives a -1 to their Initiative for every 5 levels the Barbarian has obtained

ENDURANCE TRAINING A Barbarian is used to running and jumping for hours on end and gain a -1 to their Encumbrance for every 2 levels obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Barbarians haven’t benefited fully from the learning of more advanced civilizations. All Skills with Int as a relevant ability cost 2 CrP more.

BERSERKER

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Berserker is a child of war, often raised from an early age in the most punishing conditions to harden them. In battle they fly into a primal rage, craving through enemies like warm butter.

VITALITY DIE

higher of 2d12

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Berserkers receive no skills but they do receive 1 Weapon Basic Training and the Aggressive Fighter Mastery for free.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

PAIN TOLERANT The Berserker has learned to simply overpower his pain sensors and keep fighting. At 1st level, he gains a - 3 bonus to his Trauma check. This increased by 1 for every 2 levels he's obtained.

SCARIFICATION For every battle and victim, the Berserker scars himself to commemorate his victory. Over time, these scars serve as armor as his skin hardens. The Berserker gains 1 DR at first level and for every 4 levels obtained. Against a weapon, use whichever is highest (whether it’s the /D or static DR). This ability does stack with armor but the scars chaff and rub, so double any penalties gained from wearing it.

This scarification is unsettling to look upon. The Berserker also gains a 2d8 Trait “Intimidating Presence” because of them. This is separate from the Trait “Battle Scars”.

BATTLE FRENZY These warriors are able to drive themselves into a crazed frenzy, giving them almost supernatural abilities. While in a Battle Frenzy, the Berserker doubles his bonuses from Pain Tolerant and Scarification and makes them temporarily immune to penalties from Stress, though they still gain Stress from Wounds as per normal.

The DR granted from Scarification also applies to the damage dealt by Running and Sprinting, however, it is effectively halved for Sprinting.

On top of this, whenever they kill an opponent, they heal an amount of damage equal to the amount under 0 he puts them. So, a Berserker deals 10 damage to a person with 6 Vitality left, bringing the enemy to -4 and healing the Berserker 4 Vitality.

The Battle Frenzy increases as the warrior nears death. When a Berserker is Hurt they gain an additional dice of damage equal to their Honor Die and when Wounded they gain another. This doesn't increase the effective dice number.

There are drawbacks to the Frenzy. The first is that the Berserker can take no defensive actions. This includes any defensive Tactics but also prevents him from actively crouching behind his shield for cover or Taking a Breather and, when doing aggressive actions, they are less careful, doubling their penalties from the same. Additionally, there is a price to pay for driving your body for so long; when you drop out of the Frenzy, you take enough damage, on one Wound, to drop you another Vitality Category. You also gain no benefits from Taking a Breather after doing so until you drop another Vitality Category (so you can't just heal it back up, sorry).

This Frenzy is awoken by the Berserker and takes 3d6 seconds to get into, during which time the Berserker beats his chest, screams at the sky, and just generally psyches himself up. The more wounded the Berserker becomes, however, the easier it is to get into the right frame of mind, so remove a d6 for every Vitality Category he has dropped.

SHARED FRENZY Some of the manic power the Berserker commands overflows and invigorates his allies. Those on the Berserker’s side can Run for an additional 3 seconds per Berserker level and can Sprint an additional 1 second per Berserker level.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Berserkers are killers and can sometimes get lost in the glory of battle. After downing every foe on the battlefield, they need to make a Wisdom check. On a failure, they’re unable to calm down and attack the nearest person, friendly or not. After every attack they make, they can make another Wis check to try and snap out of it. Failure indicates they keep attacking.

BRAWLER

🜂 Advanced Rule

On the streets or in the arena, you’ll find the Brawler, battling it out. For the joy of throwing their opponents around like a rag doll, they fight. Brawlers are unarmed fighters primarily, eager to toss anyone that opposes them aside.

VITALITY DIE

d12

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Brawlers receive 1 free purchase of the Streetwise Skill Suite.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

REGISTERED WEAPONS The Brawler knows how to appear like a threat, even when unarmed. They always count as having a weapon for Weapon Style.

IMPROVED ADVANCED TRAINING Brawlers train to be deadly artists with their fists and soon gain a knack for it. For Brawlers, Tier 1 Unarmed Advanced Training has a Base Cost of 5.

MARTIAL TRAINING A Brawler receives a free Weapon Advanced Training for Unarmed Combat for every level he’s obtained.

OPPORTUNISTIC FIGHTER Part of being a streetfighter is seizing every chance you get to get ahead. A Brawler and his allies score a Near Perfect Attack and Defense on a roll of 18 and 19.

IMMOVABLE By planting yourself and watching your structure, you can really push people around. You gain an effective + 1 to your Vitality Size Modifier for Knock Backs. On top of this, you lower your enemy's Vitality Size Modifier by 1 for Knock Backs as well. This bonus increased by 1 every level.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Something about being a Brawler makes them shun weapons where they can’t get up and personal with their opponent. Ranged Weapon Advanced Trainings cost 2 CrP more.

CATERAN

The Cateran is all about flanking your opponent and keeping other fighters locked down. As such, they work best with other fighters.

VITALITY DIE

d8

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Caterans receives the Deadly Flanker Mastery, as well as free Light Armor Basic Training and 1 Weapon Basic Training.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

BABY-SITTING While an individual Cateran may vary in his ability to take care of infants, they all share the ability to keep combatants locked down.

Whenever a person engaged with the Cateran tries to disengage, the Cateran gets an immediate free attack that, if it hits, deals half damage. This happens regardless of where they are on the Clock and doesn’t effect when their next attack happens.

CLOSED OPENINGS Flanking is the art of dividing people’s attention and the Cateran has perfected that art. Anyone flanked by a Cateran lowers their attack die by 1 size, regardless of who they’re attacking.

MUTIEREN A Cateran knows to move their blade to get into places their opponents wouldn't expect. If facing an enemy who's weapon has a base Parry or who is carrying a shield, the Cateran recieves a +1 to Attack +1 for every 2 levels they've obtained. This ability isn't effective against people who gained their Parry solely through training.

SHADOWING By keeping close to their opponent, the Cateran can negate people’s defensive posturing. By taking 15 Stress, a Cateran can negate any bonuses an opponent gets from moving, whether that’s shifting, stepping back, or whatever and also stops their opponent from moving.

The Cateran can do this as many times as they want but the Stress cost doubles each time they do so, though this resets once they’ve had time to destress. Also, this Stress cost is lowered by 1 for every 2 levels they’ve obtained.

BUM RUSH A Cateran can also use his allies to more effectively flank their opponents. The Cateran can give any other allies flanking the same enemy the benefits of the Deadly Flank Mastery if they don’t have it.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

The Cateran is a group fighter and fighting alone can be unnerving for him. When engaged with enemies alone and not flanking, the Cateran is unable to use his Honor.

MAN-AT-ARMS

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Man-at-Arms uses his own know-how against his opponents. She gets more deadly the more Masteries she gains. With this she can adapt to who she is fighting where others can’t.

VITALITY DIE

d10

SKILLS & MASTERIES

The Man-at-Arms receive 1 free purchase of the Athletics Skill Suite. They also receive 3 free Weapon Basic Training Masteries.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

KNOW YOUR ENEMY A Man-at-Arms is good at using watching her foe and exploiting weaknesses. For every 20 seconds she is either Threatening someone or someone is Threatening her, she gains a cumulative bonus to Attack, Defense, Recovery, or Damage. This bonus, and what she can choose to apply it to is based on her Advanced Weapon Basic Training.

Tier 4 gives her a +1, Tier 3 gives her a +2, and Tier 2 and under give her a +3. She can only apply this bonus to a metric she has an Advanced Training Bonus in. So, for example, if she is fighting someone with a slashing sword and she has a +1 to Attack and Defense with all Slashing weapons (Tier 3), that means, for every 20 seconds she is fighting that person, she can add an additional +2 to her Attack or Defense.

This bonus is applied to one metric per person and everything reset should that foe become completely unengaged wit her. So, if the Man-At-Arms is Threatening two foes for 20 seconds, she can apply her bonus to attacking one, while the other bonus goes to defending against another. If one she is defending against leaves, she has to continue applying her bonus to attacking the other. Should that foe threaten her again, she gains no bonuses again him but can change to attacking him as well.

The time it takes to accure this bonus is lowered 1 second for level the Men-at-Arms obtains, down to a minimum 1 second.

COUNTING COUP Part of being a Man-at-Arms is keeping a reputation for your skill in combat and this can often become a game that everyone gets caught up in. If you give yourself a penalty to Attack, you gain 1 Honor and gain Relaxation equal to that penalty if you score a hit. If you've already used this ability once this Combat, your allies may do so as well, gaining an additional point of Relaxation (but not Honor) for each teammate who's successfully couted coup before them.

MARTIAL TRAINING A Man-at-Arms receives his choice of a free Tier 3 or 4 Armor, Shield, or Weapon Advanced Training for every levels he's obtained.

IMPROVED ADVANCED TRAINING A Man-at-Arms studies the greatest weapon, armor, and shield techniques to pick them up easier. For them, Tier 2 Weapon, Shield, Armor Advanced Training has a Base Cost of 7, Tier 3 has a Base Cost of 8, and Tier 4 a Base Cost of 10.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

Men-at-Arms fight and when they lose, it’s hard on them: they lose 5 Honor for every combat they’re knocked unconscious or fail a Trauma check in due to humiliation.

KNIGHT

The Knight focuses on shield and armor, and with their larger Vitality Die, they tend to be pretty tanky. Additionally, their Inheritance allows them to get the more expense weapons for free.

VITALITY DIE

d12

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Knights receive 1 free purchase of the Tactics Skill Suite.

Knights receive the Armor Basic Training (Heavy), Shield Basic Training, and 1 Weapon Basic Training Mastery for free.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

IMPROVED ADVANCED TRAINING A Knight is a master of armor and defense, spending years conditioning himself to be able to wear armor and use a shield without breaking a sweat. For Knights Tier 2 Armor and Shield Advanced Training has a Base Cost of 8, Tier 3 has a Base Cost of 10 and Tier 4 a Base Cost of 14.

CHIVALRY From their strict code comes a strength and confidence that others can only dream of and envy. For the duration of a combat you gain 1 free use of your Honor Die. You gain an additional free Honor Die for every level you obtain. You can only apply 1 of these bonus Honor Die to a single roll, though that doesn’t stop you adding Honor Dice that you’ve gotten from other sources.

CALL to VALOR A Knight is a hero and inspires others to rise above. For the duration of a combat all allies gain 1 free use of an Honor Die to share between them. They gain an additional free Honor Die for every 4 levels you’ve obtained. They can only apply 1 of these bonus Honor Dice to a single roll, though that doesn’t stop them adding Honor Dice that they got from other sources, and the Honor Dice is the size of the person’s Honor Dice that redeems it.

INHERITANCE This character may have had an extra leg up in life, allowing them the opportunity to start with better equipment than others. They gain a free weapon of their choice or a Courser mount and also gain 15 sc for each CrP cashed in at the end of Character Creation.

MARTIAL TRAINING A Knight receives a free Tier 3 Armor or Shield Advanced Training for every levels she’s obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

The Knight is a creature of Honor and respects Honor where they find it. They may be killers but they have a code, whether articulated or not. A Knight may never use a long ranged weapon on a foe that has greater than Average Honor.

SKIRMISHER

🜂 Advanced Rule

Skirmishers never stay in one place longer than they have to and so are rewarded for constantly being on the move. They’re also adept at making the most of their enemies disorientation, either from surprise or from the chaos they cause.

VITALITY DIE

d6

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Skirmishers gain the Attack on the Run mastery for free as well as 1 Basic Weapon Training for free. They also gain 1 purchase of the Athletics Skill Suite and 4 free purchases in the Endurance Advanced Skill

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

DIRE AMBUSH Catching an enemy off guard can spread confusion and disorientation that can limit an enemy’s ability to respond. Whenever the Skirmisher hits a surprised enemy, that enemy receives -2 to Attack and Defense for the next 7 seconds. Additionally, should they move above a Walk during this time, they gain an additional -2 for each Movement Category above such for that duration.

COMBAT READY A Skirmisher is ready to go at any time. They lower their Initiative Dice down by 1 size per level they’ve obtained, down to a d2.

GUERILLA FIGHTING Skirmishers are masters at getting in, doing some damage, and getting out, causing confusion as they move.

If someone attacks the Skirmisher while she is at a Jog or higher, or misses an attack when she disengages with someone, the enemy is left open for two seconds. If hit within that window, then the enemy receives a -3 to Attack for 7 seconds + 1 every level.

RAID TACTICS Confusion allows those to dart in and out, dealing terrible damage. While receiving penalties from the Skirmisher, enemies are unable to capitalize and get no free attacks when someone disengaged with them.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

The Skirmisher moves and so quickly loses her edge when pinned down. She receives a -2 for every 5 seconds she hasn’t moved at least 5 ft in combat.

SOLDIER

🜂 Advanced Rule

Bonfire character are not meant to stand alone and this goes double for the Soldier, who work the best with others. They’re able to shadow others around the battlefield and really focus on being good at one or two weapons.

VITALITY DIE

d8

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Soldiers receive 1 free purchase of the Tactics Skill Suite.

Soldiers receive either the Armor Basic Training (Light) and Shield Basic Training or Armor Training (Medium). On top of this, they gain 1 Weapon Basic Training Mastery for free as well.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

SMALL UNIT TACTICS Soldiers work as a team. If they or anyone they’re adjacent uses a tactic that moves them (Shift, Step Back, etc.), the Soldier or their adjacent ally may also use that Tactic with no penalties.

IMPROVED ADVANCED TRAINING Soldiers rely on others to make up for their weaknesses, as such, that gives them greater freedom to really specialize in what they’re good at. For Soldiers Tier 1 Weapon Advanced Training have a Base Cost of 6.

BUDDY SYSTEM Soldiers fight as a unit, moving and acting as one where possible. When an adjacent ally switches Tactics, the Soldier may immediately switch to that Tactic as well. On top of this, they also receive a -1 bonus to their Trauma checks, which increased by 1 for every level the soldier has obtained

MARTIAL TRAINING A Soldier receives a free Tier 1 Weapon Advanced Training for every level he’s obtained.

PRIMARY DRAWBACK

A Soldier focuses so much time drilling with his preferred weapon that he can often forget that principles with one weapon can apply to another. All Tier 4 and above Weapon Advanced Trainings are 2 CrP more expensive.

TACTICIAN

🜂 Advanced Rule

The Tactician is a jack of all trades but master of none, focusing on being slightly less skilled at a multitude of weapons. This means that the Tactician will probably have the right weapon for the right enemy. On top of this, the Tactician is skilled at the use of Combat Tactics (hence the name) which allows them to seize opening that others can’t. Overall, the Tactician focuses on versatility.

VITALITY DIE

d8

SKILLS & MASTERIES

Tacticians receive 1 free purchase of the Tactics Skill Suite.

Tacticians receive the Armor Basic Training (Medium) Mastery and 2 Weapon Basic Trainings for free.

ARCHETYPE ABILITIES

QUICK OR DEAD A Tactician lives on his wits. While others rely on training, he works on instinct and so can often take advantage of situations that others can’t.
