WEAPON BONUSES

Bardiche This weapon can be braced for a charge. It takes 3 second to do so and deals double damage to charging foes if you hit.

Bellybow All this weapon’s damage is counted as if it were on 1 dice for /D armor.

Recovery Masteries for this weapon remove 1.5 seconds (rounded down) off their Recovery per bonus instead of 1.

Bill Damage with this weapon is effectively doubled for Knock-Backs vs mounted defenders.

Bludgeon Damage with this weapon is effectively doubled for Trauma checks.

Composite Bow This is the only mechanical ranged weapon that may be used from horseback.

This weapon requires two hands regardless of size.

Court Sword When rolling damage, reroll the lowest die. It’s doesn’t explode.

Crossbow If you steady this weapon against the ground or a stand, you may double your Attack bonus from mastery with this weapon.

Recovery Masteries for this weapon remove 1.5 seconds (rounded down) off their Recovery per bonus instead of 1.

Dagger This weapon can be used as either a Slashing or Piercing weapon. You only need one Weapon Basic Training and any Weapon Advanced Trainings (except for Tier 3 - in which case use the highest) count for both.

Estoc When wielding this weapon two handed, damage from it is effectively dealt on 1 die.

Fire Lance This weapon’s loud noise causes everyone to duck. Everyone within its range flinches for a number of seconds equal to 1 of the d10s, determined before hand (see Terrain and Situational Factors section of Chapter 10). This includes the gunner as well. If they’re still surprised, they can act after those seconds are over. This includes the gunner as well. If several firearms have gone off on the same second, you take the highest delay rolled. Additionally, those already stunned by a firearm when another goes off are unaffected by that firearm's delay.

This is a single use weapon.

Guisarme Damage with this weapon is effectively doubled for Knock-Backs vs mounted defenders.

Halberd This weapon can be used as either a Slashing or Piercing weapon. You only need one Weapon Basic Training and any Weapon Advanced Trainings (except for Tier 3 - in which case use the highest) count for both.

Hakenbuchse If you steady this weapon against the ground or a stand, you may double your Attack bonus from mastery with this weapon.

Recovery Masteries for this weapon remove 1.5 seconds (rounded down) off their Recovery per bonus instead of 1.

This weapon also comes with a drop down pole that takes 5 seconds to deploy or stow away.

This weapon’s loud noise causes everyone to duck. Everyone within the first two range categories of this weapon flinches for a number of seconds equal to what the smaller of its two damage dice rolls (see Terrain and Situational Factors section of Chapter 10). If they’re still surprised, they can act after those seconds are over. This includes the gunner as well. If several firearms have gone off on the same second, you take the highest delay rolled. Additionally, those already stunned by a firearm when another goes off are unaffected by that firearm's delay.

This weapon Backfires (see sidebar).

Back Firing

On a roll of 1 on your attack dice, this weapon jams, making it unusable until repaired.

On top of this, you need to roll another d20. On the roll of 20, the gun still goes off but does half damage and the firing mechanism is broken so the firearm is unusable until repaired.

On the roll of a second 1, the gun backfires, dealing half damage to you. At least, it’s not jammed?

Handgonne This weapon’s loud noise causes everyone to duck. Everyone within the first two range categories of this weapon flinches for a number of seconds equal to what the smaller of its two damage dice rollss (see Terrain and Situational Factors section of Chapter 10). If they’re still surprised, they can act after those seconds are over. This includes the gunner as well. If several firearms have gone off on the same second, you take the highest delay rolled. Additionally, those already stunned by a firearm when another goes off are unaffected by that firearm's delay.

This weapon Backfires (see sidebar).

Handaxe This weapon can be used either in melee or as the Throwing Axe. Tier 1 Masteries must be purchased separately but Tier 2 Masteries are shared.

Lance When mounted, this weapon can be wielded 1 handed without penalty.

Also, while mounted, this weapon does shield damage.

Lochaber Axe This weapon can be braced for a charge. It takes 3 second to do so and deals double damage to charging foes if you hit.

Javelin If this weapon strikes a shield and its damage is greater than the shield’s DR, the javelin has gotten lodged in the shield’s surface.

The Defender must either spend 2d6! seconds pulling it out or defend with a base 1d12! for as long as he continues to use the shield.

Unlike other ranged weapons, you add your Damage Modifier from Strength to your damage.

Knife This weapon can be used either in melee or as the Throwing Knife. Tier 1 Masteries must be purchased separately but Tier 2 Masteries are shared.

Koncerz This weapon is designed for use on horseback. Double its damage dice while mounted.

Lucerne This counts as having one effective less damage dice for the purposes of /D.

Peasant’s Flail This weapon can get around guards more effectively. While attacking someone, reduce their Parry by 4.

Throwing Axe If this weapon strikes a shield and it’s damage is greater than the shield’s DR, the axe has gotten lodged in the shield’s surface.

The Defender must either spend 2d6! seconds pulling it out or defend with a base 1d12!.

Unlike other ranged weapons, you add your Damage Modifier from Strength to your damage.

This weapon can be used either as a ranged weapon or as a handaxe. Tier 1 Masteries must be purchased separately but Tier 2 Masteries are shared.

Scourge This weapon can get around guards more effectively. While attacking someone, reduce their Parry by 4.

Sabre This weapon is designed for use on horseback. Double its damage dice while mounted.

Schiavona This weapon is designed for use on horseback. Double its damage dice while mounted.

Sovnya This weapon is designed for use on horseback. Double its damage dice while mounted.

Throwing Knife This weapon can be used either as a ranged weapon or as a knife. Tier 1 Masteries must be purchased separately but Tier 2 Masteries are shared.

Unlike other ranged weapons, you add your Damage Modifier from Strength to your damage.

Unarmed This is the character’s bare knuckles and so they pose less of a threat to those attacking with a weapon, meaning attackers double their weapon’s Recovery against unarmed opponents.

On explosions, the additional dice are at a -2, instead of the standard -1.

Warbow This weapon must be used from a prone position, bracing the body of the bow with your legs. It takes 10 second + the Encumbrance of your armor to get up, but only a 3 seconds to drop prone.

War Flail This weapon can get around guards more effectively. While attacking someone, reduce their Parry by 4.

Zweihander This weapon is built for breaking and chopping. When this weapon strikes a weapon or a shield, reduce its effective number of dice to 3. More on this is found in the Weapon & Shield Breakage section below.

Armor Stats
Name Dr Def Init Mod Rec Mod Type Encumb Skill Adj
Pelt 1 -1 0 0 Light 0 1/2
Bone 2 -2 2 0 Light 5 2/2
Buff Coat 3 -2 1 0 Light 5 1/1
Gambeson 3 -1 0 1 Light 2 1/1
Leather 4 -1 1 1 Light 4 1/2
Coat Of Plates 1/d -2 0 0 Medium 5 2/3
Scale 2/d 0 3 1 Medium 8 3/4
Lamellar 3/d -5 1 2 Medium 6 3/5
Brigandine 3/d -1 0 4 Medium 3 2/4
Maile 1/d + 2 -1 1 2 Heavy 4 2/3
Interlocking Maile 3/d + 1 -3 4 3 Heavy 4 2/4
Plated Maile 3/d + 3 -4 4 4 Heavy 8 2/4
Full Plate 4/d + 2 -4 4 5 Heavy 10 3/4

ARMOR TABLE HEADER EXPLANATION

DR This number is subtracted from the damage dealt by a weapon.

Def All armor weighs you down and makes it harder to dodge incoming attacks. This number is added to your Defense roll.

Init Mod Armor is restricting, even at the best of times. This is added to your Initiative roll at the start of combat.

Rec Mod Again, armor is restricting. This is added to your weapon’s Recovery.

Type This donates what category your armor falls in. You should note that should you purchase Medium or Heavy armor, this comes with a Gambeson that’s worn underneath for comfort. This is already factored into the other stats of the armor.

Weight This is how heavy your armor is for encumbrance when your armor is carried on your person. Worn armor doesn’t count towards your encumbrance.

Encumb This number is added to your Encumbrance as doing things with a weight on you is tiring.

Skill Adj Armor, regardless of how fitted, is restricting and heavy, making it harder to perform certain skills in certain gear. The first number is what you apply to Str based skills, while the second is how many for Dex based skills.

In the case of a skill being both Str and Dex based, use the larger of the two numbers.

ARMOR BONUSES

Bone This armor is especially effective when channelling magic. It only increases your channelling time by 5 if the legs and arms are uncovered and 10 if you wear the gauntlets and boots.

SHIELD TABLE HEADER EXPLANATION

Size This indicates the general size of a shield. It also determines how tough your shield is.

DR This number is subtracted from the damage dealt by a weapon on a successful parry with a shield.

Def This is the number that you subtract from your character’s defense. Lugging a huge piece of material on the end of your arm makes dodging a bit difficult. Additionally, you’re often moving a shield into harm’s way, meaning, overall, you get hit more while wielding one.

Parry Some shields are balanced better than others and that allows you to deflect blows more effectively. This number is the shield’s Parry Threshold. This is overrides by your weapon’s Parry. Parrying with a shield subjects it to the Shield Breakage rules.

Cover This dice is added to your Defense roll against ranged weapons. If you’re actively crouching behind it, you instead add the maximum value of any dice and roll of that dice (i.e., a d8, you add d8 + 8, for d12 + d8, you add d12 + d8 + 20, etc.).

Flanks This is the number of additional attackers from the side that the shield can defend against. More on that is found in Chapter 10: Combat

Weight This is how heavy your shield is for encumbrance.

Encumb This number is added to your Encumbrance as doing things with a weight on you is tiring.

Bonus Some shields have additional unique bonuses. If there is a ‘yes’ in this column, look up the shield in the following section to find out more details.

Shield Stats
Name Size Dr Def Parry Cover Flanks Encumb Bonus
Buckler S 3/d + 8 -2 6 - 2 3 Yes
Clothe S 6 0 5 - 2 2
Figure Eight M 2/d + 6 -2 8 d6 3 8 Yes
Heater L 2/d + 4 -7 15 d12 4 13
Kite M 2/d + 4 -2 8 d8 3 8
Light S 3/d + 6 -1 6 d6 2 6
Pavise L 4/d + 2 -8 0 d20 2 20 Yes
Round M 2/d + 8 -5 10 d10 3 8 Yes
Tower L 2/d + 1 -8 16 d12+d4 4 9

SHIELD & WEAPON BREAKAGE When you parry with a shield or weapon, there’s a chance of it breaking from the blow.

If the attacker manages to score enough damage after the shield or weapons DR to get over the appropriate Shield & Weapon Breakage threshold, a saving throw is made with the attack rolling a d20! and the defender rolling the corresponding dice.

Shield And Weapon Breakage
Type D20!+10 D20! D20!-10
Polearms 10 15 20
Shields & Armor 15 20 25
Other Weapons 20 25 30

A failed check on a weapon nets a cumulative -1 to Attack and Damage for a weapon until it can be repaired.

A failed check for a shield nets a cumulative -1 to Defense, Parry Threshold, and DR until it can be repaired.

On a success, the weapon or shield has managed to withstand the blow and gains no more penalties.

SHIELD BONUSES

Buckler The buckler is a lightweight shield which relies more on parrying blows than outright stopping them. The buckler also has the added benefit of being rather small with almost no weight, allowing it to be worn but not used while wielding two handed weapons. You receive no bonuses when doing this but it means that if you do switch over to a one handed weapon, you instantly get the buckler’s bonus.

Figure Eight This shield is designed specifically for phalanx or shield wall tactics. This gives a +2 Parry and a Cover of d4 to anyone fighting on either side of you. This stacks with any Parry or Cover that they have from either their weapon or shields.

Pavise This shield is less a shield and more portable cover employed by gunners and crossbowman, rather than fighters.

However, the Pavise can be set up using a kick stand in the back, giving anyone crouching behind it basically complete cover and allowing that person the ability to steady their weapon on it.

Round This shield was meant for hitting your opponent, trying to throw them off guard. On a natural roll of 20 on Defense or an Unarmed Strike, you delay your opponent’s next attack by 5 seconds.

The Weird

WHAT IS WEIRD?

Seems like a reasonable place to start. It is called a lot of things by different cultures: mana, magic, juju, but essentially, it’s the metaphysical power that allows people to reshape reality, which is why working with it is often called weirdshaping, or simply shaping, if you don’t want to sound pretentious.

Weird lies beneath the surface of all things, a hidden power that imbues life with those indescribable feelings. It is the reason you feel attracted to someone at first sight, are speechless when you see a beautiful view, or the reason why planets have healing properties. It is not that some things are inherently ‘magical’ or ‘non-magical’ - all things have weird that is waiting to be shaped.

ANATOMY OF A SPELL

When you shape the weird, it manifests in the Middle Realm as a spell, which is broken up into different parts or “Rudiments”, which are split into types. More details on the specifics is found under the Acquiring Rudiments section below but here’s a brief overview:

SHAPE This is the shape that the spell shows up in. This can be a circle, cone, or wall, for example.

RANGE This depends on the Shape of the spell but generally it’s the reach of the spell: how long is the cone or how far can you launch a salvo shaped spell.

ORIGIN This is where the spell comes into being: this can start as the caster and emanate out, it can imminent from his touch, or it can manifest yards away from him.

EFFECT This is where the spell usually gets its name and it’s what it actually does. A spell can cause Stress, remove friction, change appearances, and so on. Effects will also list the Interval, which will talk about next, and the base Range for that spell.

Effects are also special because you can add multiple Effects (or even the same effect multiple times, thus making it more powerful) to the same spell but increasing the Drain in the same amount. If it isn’t clear how an Effect would work if Stacked with itself, there’s a Stacking section for each Effect that should clear things up.

SHAPING A SPELL

Each of a spell’s Rudiments will have a Drain value, which added together, is how much that spell costs to cast. A spell must have at least 1 of each Rudiment type.

FALLOUT

Bending reality and shaping primordial force is not an easy thing to do and nature doesn’t like it. When you first cast a spell, you take Stress equal to your Encumbrance.

WEIRD TRADITIONS

Ways of shaping the Weird are split up into different “Traditions”, which with their own bent on ways the Weird can manifest. These are:

ANIMISM

This Tradition focuses on the manipulation of the body, forcing it to endure beyond its normal limits and making it into a weapon.

CALLING

This Tradition focuses on the Realms beyond the Middle one we’re so fond of. It involves the summoning of demons, elementals, and spirits.

CHARM

This focuses on the manifestation of the Weird in its raw and primal form. This allows the Weird to interact with our world in a more physical way.

GLAMOUR

This Tradition focuses on the manipulation of the senses, tricking the brain into seeing what the caster wants you to see.

INVESTITURE

This focuses on inanimate objects and either imbuing them with power or manifesting the latent potential that is already in them.

OCCULTISM

This Tradition focuses on the hidden world and opening of the third mind: the divination of knowledge and the unseen.

SORTILEGE

This Tradition focuses on fate, chance, and probability: more specifically, it focuses on messing with it so that things go in your favor.

ALTERNATIVE WAYS TO CAST

🜂 Advanced Rule

SIMULCASTING

If you have enough SP, you may cast more than one spell in the same second, however you gain 1 Stress for each additional spell cast this way.

CONCERT CASTING

For Wild Magic-Users, it is possible to unite your spirits and channel together, thus improving your channelling overall.

When Concert Casting, there is a ‘lead’ Magic User who casts the spell. Each person added either their channelling dice reduced by 1 size for each additional person (down to a d4!) who’s also adding dice or reduces the channelling time, though it takes 1 person to reduce it by 1 second, 2 additional people for the next second (so 3 total), and so on.

To effectively Concert Cast, all Magic Users must remain linked through physical contact, though not all of them need to touch the lead Magic User you must be able to be able to trace from that channeller to the lead, but beyond that, they must have some connection with each other. Each channeller needs to have a Devotion to the lead Magic User or the casting will simply not work.

The lead Magic User takes all the SP from the other and uses it to cast his spell, though he’s still affected by his SP limit and may gain Stress because of it.

ACQUIRING RUDIMENTS

At 1st level and as dedicated by your Archetypes, you’ll have the opportunity to acquire new Rudiments, which you can then use to shape spells. You’ll do so by picking a Rudiment table and then rolling on it. If you roll a Rudiment you already have, you may select the Rudiment on either side of it. For Effects, you roll on the Effects By Tradition table and then go to the corresponding subtable. You may spend a CrP to reroll as per the norm, even during level up.

Players that seek out the knowledge to gain a specific Rudiment during play can forgo this roll and simply gain that Rudiment, however, they can’t learn more Rudiments than their Archetype and level dictates.

At first level, it is required that you have at least 1 Rudiment from each type (so, 1 Shape Rudiment, 1 Origin Rudiment, and so on) but once that’s satisfied they can go back.

Shape Rudiments
Roll (d8)
1 - 2 Circle
3 Chain
4 Cone
5 Salvo
6 Sphere
7 Ray
8 Wall
Range Rudiments
Roll (d4)
1 Double
2 Full
3 Half
4 Personal
Origin Rudiments
Roll (d4)
1 Aura
2 Touch
3 Near
4 Far
Effects Rudiments
Roll (d8)
1 Animism
2 Calling
3 Charm
4 Glamour
5 Investiture
6 Occult
7 Sortilege
8 Reroll

Roll on the Effects by Traditions Table to determine which Effects Table to roll on. If you have Arcane Training in a specific Tradition, you can skip the Effects by Traditions table and go straight to rolling on any table you have training in.

Animism Effects
Roll (d12)
1 Animate Corpse
2 Bestial Sight
3 Corpse Hide
4 Endow With Power
5 Haste
6 High Jump
7 Icarian Flight
8 Leadfeet
9 Outcry
10 Sap Power
11 Slow Metabolism

1 Banish
2 - 6 Bind Demon
7 - 11 Bind Elemental Heart
12 Break Summoning
13 Corpse Tongue
14 Dominate
15 Essense Link
16 Force Bind Spirit
17 Hookgate

4 - 5 Force Push

12 Shock
13 Silence

2 Charismatic Glamour

4 Discombobulate

7 Mask of Zal
8 - 10 Mimic
11 Mypoic Curse
12 Perfume

18 - 20 Visual Illusion

1 Bar Portal
2 Binding Glyph
3 Burden
4 - 5 Flash Bang
6 Itembind

9 - 10 Marionette
11 Mystic Mark
12 Mystical Sanding
13 Phasing

15 - 16 Shatter
17 - 18 Strobe
19 Weaponsharp

1 Alarm
2 - 3 Ancestral Lore
4 Augur Secret
5 - 6 Detect Magic
7 Divine Object
8 - 9 Dreamstride
10 Hindsight
11 - 12 Invoke Belligerence
13 - 14 Lore Mysterium
15 Message
16 - 17 Mind Wipe
18 Scry
19 Strengthen Ymir
20 Tongues
Sortilege Effects
Roll (d12)
1 Arcane Vortex
2 Bind to the Average
3 Deathwatch
4 Fate Well
5 Fortify Luck
6 Heroic Moment
7 Hex
8 Improbable Stair
9 Inflict Bad Luck
10 Mislay
11 Rebalance
12 Ricochet

TEACHING YOUR SPELLS TO OTHERS

Magic spells are complex things with more layers than an onion, so it’s not a simple task to teach another a spell you know, even if they’re using the same magic system.

The first step is to be taught the basic of the spells. This is an Arcana Skill Challenge with the penalty being set by which type of magic is doing the teaching and learning.

For instance, a Sourcerer’s understanding of magic is innate, making it hard to articulate how they’re able to do something to someone who understands that same thing through study. In the same way, Wizards and Mages shape magic completely differently than Speakers who shape spells using the Divine Language.

This takes a 1d4! days of study and teaching, as well as ‘dry’ runs, after which the Check is made.

If it’s successful, the person has the basics and may gain that spell as part of their normal level up (instead of rolling a random spell) or they may learn is instantly, but this takes additional work, costing them CrP to the tune of 25 - the learner’s Int score, as they have to devote additional time to finally cementing it in memory, time that might be taking up with other things.

A failure indicates that more time and study must be taken, increasing the days of study by 1 dice size (d6! days of study for the second try, d10! for the fourth attempt and so on).

Spell Transfer
Learning
Teaching
Wild Sourcerous True Naming Vancian
Wild -4 -2 X -8
Sourcerous -8 0 -12 X
True Naming X -6 -6 -4
Vancian -8 -2 -4 X

SHAPE RUDIMENT DESCRIPTIONS

Note that all shapes glow slightly with strange lumiences, alerting people where the spell is.

CIRCLE

DRAIN 2

The Circle is the most basic Shape. It extends from the Origin with a Radius equal to the Base Range of the Effect. Anyone within the Circle is affected by the spell. If it deals damage or inflicts Stress, this occurs on the Interval or if a person enters/re-enters the shape. If not cast far enough away, this could also include the caster.

CHAIN

DRAIN 0

This is the most primal Shape a spell can come in. The caster casts the spell and it chooses 1 viable, random target within the Range of the Spell. After half the spell’s Interval, it then leaps to the next. Anyone hit by the spell suffers its Effects for the entire time the spell is cast.

People may be hit multiple times, which simply counts as the spell Stacking on them, but the caster may try and redirect the spell, causing it to skip over a person, but they take Stress equal to the number of times they’ve done so.

CONE

DRAIN 3

The Cone starts with its tip at the Origin and then extends in a 45 degree arch from it up to the spell’s Range. Anyone within the Cone is affected by the spell. If it deals damage or inflicts Stress, this occurs on the Interval or if a person enters/re-enters the shape.

The Cone can also be moved and shifted, rotating around its Origin, moving a facing every 3 seconds.

SALVO

DRAIN 5

The Salvo is the spell chucked up to its Range from the spell’s Origin. It requires a ranged attack to hit (though ignoring Cover). On a miss, it follows the normal ranged miss rules. Anyone that is hit, suffers the full effects of the spell. If it deals damage or inflicts Stress, this occurs on the Interval.

Those within 10 ft of the Salvo’s touchdown location (even on a total miss) suffer the effects of the spell for half its Interval.

SPHERE

DRAIN 5

The spell takes on the shape of a 2 ft diameter sphere that flys around, coming into being at the spell’s Origin. While the caster has complete control over the direction with only minimal effort (so it doesn’t affect what else he’s doing), it still has some limitations. The first is that it only goes 10 ft / second, no faster, no slower, and the caster may only turn it 45 degrees every 3 seconds.

Anyone touched by the sphere suffers the Effects of the spell.

RAY

DRAIN 2

The ray is a thin line of magic that extends from the spell’s Origin up the 3 times the spell’s Range. It manifests in a single instant, requiring a roll to hit, but those that it hits, suffer the full Effect of the spell.

If no one was hit and the spell is still being cast, the caster can manifest another ray and try again until he hits or he decasts the spell.

WALL

DRAIN 2

The wall is a line that starts at the spell’s Origin and extends up to its Range, but also into the air and below the ground up to 50 ft. It also doesn’t have to be a straight line, weaving, twisting and turing, however, no part of it can get within 5 ft of another part. It must also be anchored to the ground. The wall cannot be moved once placed.

Anyone passing through the wall is affected by the Spell. Those that are in the wall’s way when it is cast, get a defense roll vs a ranged attack to get out of the way.

RANGE RUDIMENT DESCRIPTIONS

DOUBLE

DRAIN 1

This makes the Range of a spell twice its Base Range.

FULL

DRAIN 0

This makes the Range of a spell just its Base Range.

HALF

DRAIN 1

This makes the Range of a spell half its Base Range.

PERSONAL

DRAIN 2

This makes the Range of a spell just a single individual.

ORIGIN RUDIMENT DESCRIPTIONS

AURA

DRAIN 5

This makes it so the Origin starts at the caster (and any equipment he carries) and then extends out from them.

TOUCH

DRAIN 2

This makes it so the Origin starts at whatever the caster touches and then extends from there. If the target is trying to resist being touched, the caster needs to make an Unarmed attack against them: the caster is considered armed.

NEAR

DRAIN 1

This makes the Origin of the spell up to the Effect’s Base Range.

FAR

DRAIN 3

This makes the Origin of the spell up to double the Effect’s Base Range.

EFFECT RUDIMENT DESCRIPTIONS

ALARM

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE Trigger 50 ft, Alarm 25 ft, modified separately

INTERVAL 3 Hours

EFFECT When the defined type of being enters the Shape of the spell, it triggers the alarm, alerting everyone in the alarm range. The default definition is “Anything Humanoid” but this can be modified to make it more specific once.

STACK Make the trigger condition more specific by 1 step. If two definitions contradict one another, they are both cancelled out. You can also add another trigger condition.

For example, “Anything Orcish'' counts as 1, “Anything that’s an orc” counts as 2, and “Anything Orish or Elvish” counts as 2 as well.

ALTO SCREAM

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 30 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT A high-pitched, blood-curdling scream infects the Shape of the spell, dealing 1 Stress to everyone inside.

STACK Increase the Stress by 1.

ANCESTRAL LORE

TRADITION Occultism

COMPONENTS Fire, the Caster’s Blood

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 1 Skill Check or 6 Hours, whichever comes first

EFFECT By channeling the link in your blood, you can summon an ancestor spirit to temporarily endow you with some of their knowledge. A person within the Shape of the spell increases a Int, Wis, or Char based Skill Check by +3. Anyone within the Shape of the spell may “steal” this bonus - it is first come, first serve, regardless of what the caster wishes - and it can be done after they roll.

STACK Increase the bonus by +2.

ANIMATE CORPSE

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 30 ft

INTERVAL 4 Hours

EFFECT Animates, or assert control over, a corpse of a used-to-be sentient being within the Shape of the spell, and up to Medium in size, into mindless undead. To gain control over already raised undead they need to both be unintelligent and uncontrolled by another. This undead doesn’t think for itself and can only follow simple commands like “Stand here and attack anyone that comes through”. It can’t speak or even defend itself properly (being unable to employ Combat Tactics or gain any bonus from Flanking) and has no survival instincts. See the Animated Corpse entry in the Bestiary.

STACK Animate an additional corpse or a corpse 1 size larger.

ARCANE VORTEX

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL 30 seconds

EFFECT All spells that have shapes that overlap with the Spell Vortex are changed into Spheres and are attracted to the center or edges of this spell’s shape by the most direct route. If at the edge, they simply circle the edge. Spell caught this way cannot be released until the end of their Interval.

The direction is dictated by the caster and can be changed only once. For Arcane Vortexes that are Walls and Ray, the spells move to either end.

STACK The direction of spells can be changed an additional time during each Interval.

AUGUR SECRET

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 30 Seconds

EFFECT This finds anything that is purposely hidden from others, including hidden doors or a love letter sequestered away, within the Shape of the Spell.

The caster doesn’t automatically know what is hidden; they only know it’s exact location and general area the item takes up. The caster is also unaware if the object is moved but instantly knows the object if they touch it, even if it has.

STACK 1 more detail about the object is revealed to the caster. This is usually in the form of, first, who is hiding the secret, and then a one-word adjective that describes it.

BANISH

TRADITION Calling

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT Everyone within the Shape of the spell is temporarily banished to the Astral Plane of existence until the spell is released. Those that are banished have a sense of what is going on in the Middle Realm, though they are unable to interact with it at all.

Called creatures, demons and elementals, are permanently banished to their home plane.

STACK Increase the Base Range by 10 ft.

BAR PORTAL

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL 1 Hour

EFFECT This spell locks and seals any door or latch in the Shape of the spell. Anyone trying to bust through needs to make a Strength check vs d20! + 3 to successfully break down the door.

STACK The portal is further strengthened, giving it an additional +3.

BESTIAL SIGHT

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 30 Seconds

EFFECT This bestows everyone in the Shape of the spell one type of special vision. This covers dark vision, infrared vision, 360 vision, or aquatic vision.

STACK Either increase the Base Range by 15 ft or you may exclude a person in the Shape of the spell.

BIND DEMON

TRADITION Calling

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 25 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT This spell pulls a demon, a leftover of creation, from the aetherial void and binds it to the will of the summoner. Their stats can be found in the Bonfire Bestiary.

Demon Summoned
Roll (d20) Demon
1 Amayon
2 Astaroth
3 Belphegor
4 Deumusian
5 - 6 Gargoyle
7 Ghoul
8 - 9 Imp
10 Incubus/Succubus
11 Janusarian
12 - 13 Merihem
14 Padagogus
15 - 16 Sabnock
17 - 18 Scox
19 - 20 Sycophant

Demons are notorious shapeshifters and beguilers but through this spell, the summoner is able to force them (somewhat) into a single shape, though this is often a grotesque and twiced form. From there, the caster can order the demon to do their bidding.

There are different types and categories of demons, each with different abilities that can get a specific job. Some are brutish and stupid, while others are cunning and skillful. Some come linked with certain symbols, such as gateways or the birth of children, that give them powers related to them.

The basic spell conjures just a random demon type, which Circle value is 1, or the lowest rung of the aetherial world that exists between the other realms.

The summoner can also weigh the odds in his favor when it comes to what categories of demon he summons. He can modify the dice roll by his level in either direction

A demon appears in a random location within the Shape of the spell and rolls a d3 initiative dice.

Demons, even relatively dumb ones, are intelligent creatures and will struggle to overcome their bindings. Anytime you change a demon’s command, the demon rolls a d20 + its Circle (and the Circle of any other demons controlled by the caster) in a one round Conflict. If it wins, the caster loses control and the demon goes rogue, first seeking out the caster to try and kill them as quickly as possible. If it can’t do that, it will do as much damage as possible to what’s around it and then try to kill itself.

The caster can try to cast Bind Demon again to try and regain control. If the Circle you could have summoned is greater than the rogue demon’s Circle, you regain control... for now.

Demons are forced to stay in the area they were summoned in, following it wherever it goes if the Shape can be moved. If it breaks its binding, it may, of course, run free.

Demons are wily creatures, always trying to find loopholes in their orders and while there are implicit bindings in the summon that prevent obvious loophole breaching, they’ll do the bare minimum of what’s asked of them.

This binding does make them more susceptible to suggestion as well and others may enter into a Conflict with the demon to get it to do or reveal things, on one condition: it can’t go against their summoner’s orders.

So, a demon ordered to patrol a hall can be forced to reveal information about its master or how many people are in each room, but it can’t be forced by others to stop patrolling (or even not attack the players, should it be told to kill anyone in the hall).

STACK Increase the Circle of the demon by 1.

BIND ELEMENTAL HEART

TRADITION Calling

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 30 seconds

EFFECT This spell either conjures an elemental heart from it’s realm or binds one that has gone rogue.

Once in this realm, the elemental heart robes itself in nearby sympathetic elements, giving a form with which it can then move. Without it’s dead kin around, the heart becomes inert and defenseless. So, while there are Order and Chaos Elementals, neither of those two things have a physical manifestation in the Middle Realm and so they simply lay there.

A conjured elemental with a Weird of d4!. The higher the Weird, the more powerful the elemental. Stats for elementals are found in the Bonfire Bestiary.

Elementals are ‘liquid’ and can shift and change their form. Their Weird can be invested to increase their baseline stats and special abilities. How much this costs is determined by the type of heart summoned. Weird can assigned at the time of summoning but also rearranged after, though this takes 1 second per point shift

A summoned elemental heart appears in a random location within the Shape of the spell, determined by d12 for direction (12 being where the caster is facing and 6 being directly behind him) and d20 for distance, and rolls a d12 initiative dice. During this time, the elemental is getting its barings and forming itself proper.

Elementals are intelligent creatures and will struggle to overcome their bindings. Anytime you change an elemental’s command, the elemental rolls a d8! + its Weird (and the Weird of any other elementals controlled by the caster) in a one round Conflict. If it wins, the caster loses control and the elemental goes rogue, first seeking out the caster to try and kill them as quickly as possible

The caster can try to cast Bind Elemental Heart again to try and regain control. If the Weird you could have summoned is greater than the rogue elemental’s Weird, you regain control... for now.

If this spell is cast in any other Shape than Circle, the elemental is forced into that shape and unless the Shape can be moved, the elemental is rooted to the spot, only able to attack people who get within their Measure of that spot.

Shapes that require a roll to hit (Salvo and Ray) and do count that as the Elemental attack and thus include the Elementals damage or special attack.

STACK Increase the summoned Weird of the Elemental by d4!.

BIND TO THE AVERAGE

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL 30 seconds

EFFECT Any roll within the Shape of the spell moves 1 point towards the average. If at the average, they gain a + or - 1 depending on the whims of the caster.

STACK Either the roll moves an additional point towards the average or the bonus/penalty for being there is increased by 1.

BINDING GLYPH

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 45 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT This binds another spell to a random item within the Shape of the spell. The item is marked with a faintly glowing sigil that requires a Perception check to see if you’re not looking for it specifically.

On a condition indicated when the caster first casts the spell the bound spell goes off as if cast from the item in question.

The mage is, in effect, casting two spells at one time and needs the SP to cast both for this spell to work. After she’s done, she receives double her Encumbrance in Stress, instead of just the standard Encumbrance.

STACK Lower the Stress taken by 2: this can lower it below the base amount you would get.

BURDEN

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 30 Minutes

EFFECT Increase the size of all items on anyone within the Shape of the Spell by 1 Small.

STACK Increase them all by an addition Small.

BREAK SUMMONING

TRADITION Calling

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT By means of this spell, the caster frees any undead, elemental, or demon in the Shape of the spell from it’s summoner’s power, allowing it full autonomy as long as the spell is cast.

STACK Increase the Base Range by 10 ft.

CHARISMATIC GLAMOUR

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 25 ft

INTERVAL 1 Hour

EFFECT While Appealing to another in a Conflict, the minimum value you can get on a dice is 2.

STACK Increase the minimum value by 1.

CORPSE HIDE

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 25 ft

INTERVAL 20 Seconds

EFFECT Everyone within the Shape of the spell has their pain numbed, gaining a -1 bonus to their Trauma Checks.

STACK Increase the bonus by 1.

CORPSE TONGUE

TRADITION Calling

COMPONENTS A dead body with its tongue intact

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 15 Seconds

EFFECT This spell allows the caster to speak to the spirit through its corpse within the Shape of the spell, having it answer 1 question as truthfully as it can. Questions that last longer than the spells are simply cut off.

After this, the corpse’s tongue dissolves, preventing it from answering further questions.

STACK Increase the number of questions it answers by 1.

DISCOMBOBULATE

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 40 ft

INTERVAL 30 Seconds

EFFECT Any within the Shape of the spell becomes disoriented and is delayed 1 Second as they get their bearings.

STACK Increase the delay by 1 second.

DISPEL ENCHANTMENT

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 15 Seconds

EFFECT This increases the Drain of any spell in this spell’s Shape by 1.

STACK Increase the Drain by 1.

DARKNESS

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 30 Seconds

EFFECT This covers the Shape of the spell in Dark Lighting, as explained in Chapter 15: Misc Rules.

STACK The Base Range is increased by 15 ft.

DEATHWATCH

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT A person within the Shape of the spell gains a +3 to their stabilization checks to not bleed out.

STACK They gain an additional +3.

DETECT MAGIC

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 35 ft

INTERVAL 5 Minutes

EFFECT This reveals 1 magical item, glyph, or caster in the Shape of the spell, causing them to glow brightly. If there are multiple, it reveals a random one.

Additionally, they’ll be able to tell if any spells were cast in the general area. Though the specifics will be unknown, they’ll be able to tell the Tradition.

STACK An additional magic item, glyph, or magic user is revealed.

DIVINE OBJECT

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE .5 Mile

INTERVAL 30 Minutes

EFFECT This locates the closest object in the Shape of the spell that matches the description, which, at base, is a single noun. While the spell is active, the caster knows the exact location of the object in relation to themselves. After it’s over, the memory remains but the inner compass has faded. In the case of the object being a sentient being, it doesn’t have to know it fulfills the qualifications, making this the favored spell of Dark Overlords seeking out Children of Prophecy.

STACK Gain an adjective to describe the thing (and narrow down the responses). So, a “gold necklace” is a single adjective, and “A gold necklace with 3 rubies” is two adjectives.

DOPPELGANGER

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 35 ft

INTERVAL 20 Seconds

EFFECT This spell creates 1d4 phantoms of everyone within the Shape of the spell. These phantoms appear within 5 ft of the person and move in sync with them, following them.

The target is in a superimposed state, being, at once, one of the phantoms and none of them. Thus, she can strike from anywhere there is a phantom

These phantoms disappear on the following condition: the target makes an aggressive action of any kind, whether that’s spell casting, shooting a bow, or striking with a weapon. Even if unsuccessful, all the phantoms disappear.

And whenever someone strikes a phantom, there is a 1 in X chance of actually hitting the real person, with X being the number of phantoms that person has left. Should they actually hit the person, all the phantoms disappear. If the blow does land on a phantom, only that phantom disappears.

STACK Increase the number of phantoms created by 1 dice size.

DOMINATE

TRADITION Calling

COMPONENTS A dead body with its tongue intact

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT By means of this spell, the caster is able to link everyone within the Shape of the spell, by linking their bodies and offering a way to allow them to do tasks they would not otherwise be able to do.

People who do not wish to surrender control can choose to grossly misinterpret the commands of the controller but they still have to do what they’re ordered, unless it would result in obvious death (such as jumping off a cliff or slitting their own throats). They don’t, however, have to follow the order to the best of their ability.

They may also try and seize control through a Conflict with the current controller starting with 1 point. While playing out this Conflict may take a while, in game terms it happens within 1 second. This is a battle of wills. The winner of the Conflict takes full control over the other dominated creature.

A person can freely surrender, allowing them to mimic more intricate movements. This allows every person to roll any physical Skill Check using the controller’s Rank or to fighter using the controller’s masteries.

STACK Increase the number of points the controller starts with by 1.

DREAM STRIDE

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 5 ft

INTERVAL 1 Hour

EFFECT All willing creatures in the Shape of the spell have their spirits pushed out of their bodies as an incorporeal semi translucent form. For the first 10 seconds, the spirit is disoriented and is unable to locate their body.

While traveling in this form, the person is almost transparent, requiring a Heroic level Perception Check to notice something off. The spirit can travel up to 10 miles per hour, unhampered by terrain. The astral projection can’t speak or interact with the Middle Realm; simply passing through walls and objects but stopped by magical wards and living beings.

It’s recommended that you return to your body before the spell is released. Otherwise, your spirit is automatically thrown back into your body, which is an upsetting experience, and nets you 1 Stress per mile you are away from your body.

While under the influence of this spell, the person’s body is completely autonomous, with the caster being completely unaware about what’s going on with his body unless he’s killed in which case he’s trapped as spirit between worlds, which is a bummer.

STACK The spirit travels faster, increasing its speed by 10 miles per hour.

ENDOW WITH POWER

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 30 Seconds

EFFECT Upon casting, everyone within the Shape of the spell gains a temporary +1 to one of their physical Stats.

STACK Increase bonus to the physical stat by 1.

ESSENCE LINK

TRADITION Calling

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 30 ft

INTERVAL 20 Seconds

EFFECT Everyone within the Shape of the spell has their souls linked together, dividing all damage and Stress between them. Should this result in less than 1 damage or Stress, round up. DR only affects the person that was actually physically struck.

STACK Increase or lower the Base Range by 5 ft.

FATE WELL

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL 10 Minutes

EFFECT For every previous failed roll within the Shape of the spell, the next roll within the Shape gains a +1. This bonus is reset after a success.

STACK Every failed roll gains an additional +1.

FLASH BANG

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT The caster imbues a small object with potential, that lets out a sudden flash of light in the Shape of the spell. Blinded and startled by the flashbang, creatures in the Shape of the spell reroll their Initiative on a d4 and then adding the current second on the Clock and initiative modifier. Everyone that is affected is considered surprise with all associated penalties until their initiative comes up again.

STACK Increase the Initiative die by 1 size.

FLATTEN

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 5 ft

INTERVAL 30 Seconds

EFFECT Everyone within the Shape of the spell becomes 2D, able to be seen from a certain angle but unable to interact with the 3D world but the 3D world may interact with them. They remain plastered on the nearest flat surface, bending freely around corners as if it’s nothing and slipping through cracks.

Those in 3D space can interact with them, dealing damage if they’re facing parallel to the 2D person.

STACK Increase the Base Range by 5 ft.

FORCE BIND SPIRIT

TRADITION Calling

BASE DRAIN 10

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL A Year and a Day

EFFECT By sheer force of will, the Caller binds the escaped spirit to its body, forcing a horrible bastardization of life.

This affects all the dead in the Shape of the spell, regardless of how long it’s been dead for. This can bring them back as a skeleton or zombie based on how much meat is left.

The body continues to deteriorate, however, subtracting 10 from the max Vitality of the Bound Spirit for every month the spell wears on.

This bound spirit is stunted in many ways, as its mind and body still rots away. The bound spirit starts at its full Vitality but is unable to heal wounds by natural, magic, or divine means. Additionally, they’re unable to heal Stress. They’re also unable to gain Experience or level and their Honor is permanently set at Dishonorable.

But it’s not all bad: the bound spirit is immune to the effects of Encumbrance, though that prevents them from using the Grit Advanced Rule.

STACK Slow the deterioration by 1.

FORCE PUSH

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT This moves everyone in the Shape of the spell in the direction the caster wishes. They move at 10 ft / second - so they may try to move to counteract it, though it will obviously be less effective.

STACK Increase the speed at which victims are moved by 2.5 ft / second.

FORTIFY LUCK

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 5 ft

INTERVAL 15 seconds

EFFECT All those within the Shape of the Spell gain a “luck” point, which acts as temporary Honor, and acts and behaves like Honor for the duration of the spell. If not spent, it disappears when the spell is over.

STACK Gain an additional point of luck.

HASTE

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 40 ft

INTERVAL 10 Seconds

EFFECT Everyone within the Shape of the spell gains a boost to speed, adding 2.5 ft / second to each Movement Category.

STACK Add an additional 2.5 ft / second.

HERMETIC DWEOMER

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 5 ft

INTERVAL 10 Seconds

EFFECT Anyone within the Shape of the spell becomes surrounded by an unbreakable binding dweomer. This dweomer affects a random limb determined by a d4!

1: right hand

2: left hand

3: right leg

4: left leg

5+: random piece of equipment

Those affected by this are unable to use that limb and can no longer move, only pivoting, if it’s a leg. Equipment that is bound is unusable.

Double the dweomers against demons.

STACK Increase the number of dweomers by 1. No limb can be affected twice. Those affected by a dweomer on both the left and right side of their body can no longer pivot.

HEROIC MOMENT

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT Anyone within the Shape of the spell gains a +2 to all rolls for each Wound Category they’ve dropped.

STACK The bonus is increased by 2.

HEX

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 30 seconds

EFFECT All bad effects from failed rolls within the Shape of the spell add an additional +1. So, you take 1 more damage, gain 1 more point of Failure on a Skill Check, or your opponent gains 1 more Point on an failed Appeal. The person does have to fail a roll first to take this penalty.

STACK The bonus is increased by 1.

HIGH JUMP

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT Everyone in the Shape of the spell gains the ability to jump high. Really high. Like, 25 ft horizontally and 15 ft vertically.

STACK Add 10 ft to the horizontal jump and 5 to the vertical.

HINDSIGHT

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 25 ft

INTERVAL 10 Minutes

EFFECT While the spell is cast, any willing person within the Shape of the spell is transported up to 1 day back in time, mentally: able to see the events that are happening around them. They can move at their normal speed but are unable to interact with the past: they’re not actually time traveling, but more watching a 3d recording of past events.

STACK Increase the max days you can travel back in time by 1 day.

HOOKGATE

TRADITION Calling

COMPONENTS A token to be destroyed

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 500 ft

INTERVAL 1 Week

EFFECT The Hookgate is a spell developed by conjurers that harnesses the innate teleportation abilities of their Weird Tradition. The caster creates a summoning circle and links it to an object, normally a scrap of paper or small stone. When it is destroyed, the person who did so is taken back to a random location within the Shape of the original casting.

You may only have one Hookgate active at a time. Casting this spell again destroys any previous summoning circles.

The sudden jerk while being summoned is not at all comfortable and so the summonees gain 5 Stress for every 15 miles they travel.

STACK You can bind an additional object. If one is destroyed, all those holding a token are transported back with their tokens also destroyed.

ICARIAN FLIGHT

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 30 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT The higher they are, the harder they fall. This increases the effective fall distance within the Shape of the spell by 10 ft. Should anyone start Bleeding Out because of a fall within the Area of Effect, they burst into flames and die instantly. Note that, this counts for even the most minor changes in evaluation, so someone’s footing becoming uneven suddenly does the damage of a 10 ft fall.

STACK Increase the effective fall distance by 5 ft.

ILLUMINATE

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 25 ft

INTERVAL 15 Minutes

EFFECT This brightens the entire Shape of the spell with a supernatural light by 1 illumination category, casting away darkness and shadow.

STACK Increase the main illumination category by 1. Every 5 ft beyond the Shape, lowers it back down until the illumination category matches the rest of the surroundings.

IMPROBABLE STAIR

TRADITION Sortilege

COMPONENTS Something that could be see as a stair

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT Constructed by ancient wizards, the Improbable Stair was a means for the magi of ancient times to travel great distances instantly, however, since the deaths of the old masters, the secrets of how to use the properly Improbable Stair effectively have disappeared.

The Stair is accessed by seeing a stair in an unlikely place but within the Shape of the spell; a pile of crates or a sketch on a wall. It only has to suggest that a stair is there to work. The caster then steps on to the ‘stair’ and onto the Stair.

Every minute on the Stair allows the caster to travel d12! yards if walking, d12! miles if jogging, or d12! days’ travel if running, rolled secretly by the GM.

Others can be brought along by gripping hands with the caster and with each other but should they let go while climbing, they’ll be lost somewhere in time and space.

STACK You gain more control over where you end up: shift the result of the travel distance dice up or down by 1.

INFLICT BAD LUCK

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 10 Minutes

EFFECT For every previous failed roll within the Shape of the spell, the next roll within the Shape gains a +1. This bonus is reset after a success.

STACK Every failed roll gains an additional +1.

INFLICT DOUBT

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 30 ft

INTERVAL 1 Hour

EFFECT The person gains a +1 to his Repercussion rolls after a Conflict.

STACK Increase the Repercussion rolls by 1.

INVOKE BELLIGERENCE

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT Anyone within the Shape of the spell finds themselves absolutely unwilling to bend on what they’re arguing about. They gain an automatic 1 point in a Conflict. If the spell is over before the end of the Conflict, these points are removed.

STACK Gain another automatic point.

IRONHIDE

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 10 Seconds

EFFECT Everyone within the Shape of the spell gains +1 DR.

STACK Increase DR by 1.

ITEMBIND

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 25 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT All items within the Shape of the spell increase their Breakage Threshold by 2

STACK Increase the Breakage Threshold by 2.

KINETIC BURST

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 25 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT By releasing the potential energy in an item, the caster causes it to fly in a random direction. Small and Medium items that are not secured in the Shape of the spell fly 5 ft in a random direction. Those that are held remain held only if their wielders succeed at a Strength Check vs d20 for Small items and d20 - 15 for Medium items.

STACK The distance things fly an additional 5 ft and the d20 gets a +5.

LEADFEET

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 40 ft

INTERVAL 10 Seconds

EFFECT All creatures in the Area of Effect become lethargic, reducing their movement speed by 2.5 ft / second.

STACK Lower an additional 2.5 ft / second.

LOCKDOWN

TRADITION Calling

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 10 Seconds

EFFECT This prevents all teleportation, summoning, or banished within the Shape of the spell. This includes by the caster of this spell.

STACK Increase the Base Range by 20 ft.

LORE MYSTERIUM

TRADITION Occultism

COMPONENTS The Object in Question

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 5 ft

INTERVAL 10 Minutes

EFFECT By a powerful divination, everyone in the Shape of the spell can gain insight into a person, place, or thing within the Shape of the spell. If it is a place, the caster must be there, if a thing, it must be held, and if a person, an organic portion of that person must be held (skin, hair, teeth, or so on).

The caster gains 1 question that is answered in a factually correct way at the end of the Interval.

STACK Gain another question answered.

LIMINAL PLATFORM

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 5 ft

INTERVAL 6 Hours

EFFECT This shapes magic into a spectral platform that allows the mage to dump his excess baggage on it. It happily follows it’s summoner around until it dematerializes, holding up to 1 Medium item.

The basic shape is a disc, but this can be changed to the caster’s desired shape to better hold things, such as a bowl or hand shape but can only be as large as the Shape.

No matter the shape or size, the platform is translucent purple and is incapable of articulated action. So, a hand shaped platform can hold a weapon, but it's unable to use it to fight: it simply sits there in the air, inert.

Liminal Platforms can be lowered to the ground or up to a max of the hip height of the caster (from the ground. You can’t raise it to your hip, get on it and then raise it again). The platform doesn’t move if the caster is on top of it.

STACK Increase the Base Range by 5 ft and increase the holding capacity by 1 Medium item.

MAGIC CIRCLE

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 5 Minutes

EFFECT This spell infuses the Middle Realm with the essence of one of the Weird Traditions. Any spells of the selected Tradition that are cast in this spell’s Shape lower their Drain by 1. You can't use this ability if you're a Runegalder. If you rolled this up as one, have a free reroll on us.

STACK Lower the Drain by 1, down to a minimum of 1.

MASK OF ZAL

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 1 Hour

EFFECT Those inside the Shape of the spell can mutate their physical appearance by change 1 thing. This doesn’t affect actual stats, i.e., changing yourself to look more muscular doesn’t actually make you more muscular.

STACK Change 1 additional thing.

MARIONETTE

TRADITION Investiture

COMPONENTS A Small Object

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 5 Minutes

EFFECT By means of this spell, the caster can animate a Small object in the Shape of the spell, causing it to move about without being touched. The object in question only moves by hops and at points of articulation, so it doesn’t gain the ability to bend unnaturally.

In this way, a teapot or candlestick may hop about in a primitive form of locomotion, while a lock may only move it’s tumblers and an actual puppet may move as a person does, though this control is crude.

STACK Increase the size of the object by 1 Small.

MIMIC

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 30 ft

INTERVAL 15 Seconds

EFFECT This allows the caster to create a phantom noise anywhere within the Shape of the spell. This can be any sound, though it can’t be louder than a yell. Those listening make a Check + 15 to detect that something is wrong with the sound but only after they become suspicious of it.

STACK Reduce the bonus that listeners get to their Check by 5.

MESSAGE

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 1 Day’s Travel

INTERVAL 10 Seconds

EFFECT This communicates a message that can be fit into the Interval of spell to any area within the Shape of the Spell. Additionally, it may be left behind in an area with a trigger condition that will play the message if it’s met.

This message is vocal by nature but only those within the Shape of the spell can hear it.

STACK Increase the Base Range of this spell by 1 Day’s Travel.

MIND WIPE

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 45 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT While in the Shape of the spell, a person suffers a total brainfart on a given subject. This can be a single Advanced Skill, Mastery, or spell, as dedicated by the caster at the time of casting. They cannot use the Advanced Skill, benefit from the Mastery, or cast the spell. This affects all people the same.

STACK Wipe another Advanced Skill, Mastery, or spell.

MISLAY

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 1 Hour

EFFECT 1 Medium item (or 3 Small Items) in the spell’s Shape is hiding from scrying. It also gives the item +3 vs any type of Perception Check. A hostile action with the item dispels the effect.

STACK An additional Medium item (or 3 Small Items) is affected. This can be increased to include Large items and so on. +3 vs any type of Perception Check.

MYOPIC CURSE

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL 30 Seconds

EFFECT The visions of all those within the Shape of the spell are reduced to 30 ft.

STACK Further reduce vision by 5 ft.

MYSTIC MARK

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 5 ft

INTERVAL 1 Month

EFFECT This conjures a unique mark of identification that is put on either 1 Small object in the Shape of the spell. The mark can be made invisible except under a certain condition noted at the time of casting, but is otherwise visible.

To find this object or person again, all the caster must do to know the location of the target is close her eyes and concentrate for a minute. She then knows in what direction and how far away it is.

On top of this, any attempt to magically conceal the object or person from the caster doesn’t work.

STACK This can affect an object 1 size larger. People are considered to be size Large in this case.

MYSTICAL SANDING

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 30 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT All creatures in the Shape of the spell become frictionless and can freely slip out grapples and bonds of any kind. The caster can also affect items as long as they’re not directly touching a person. Blades glance off armor and shields, giving them an additional point of Parry and projectiles are less affected by wind resistance (as long as they’re fired from within the spell’s Shape), giving them a +1 damage.

STACK Increase Parry and/r Damage by 1.

OUTCRY

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 30 ft

INTERVAL 15 Seconds

EFFECT This forces everyone within the Shape of the spell to suddenly cry out and speak only at full volume and basically make as much noise as possible. Move Silently Checks get a -10.

STACK Move Silently Checks gain another -10.

PERFUME

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 30 ft

INTERVAL 5 Minutes

EFFECT This spell can replicate any smell that the caster is familiar within the Shape of the spell. The fragrance may be magical but it does have some mental benefits:

If it is an unpleasant scent, all those affected gain a + 5 to Checks when dealing with airborne effects of all kinds. If the effect is simply applied without a Con check, its penalties are lowered by -2. If it is a pleasant scent, swap those bonuses for penalties as people naturally breathe in deeper.

Either way, Perception Checks to detect anything airborne is also harder, gaining a +15 and if a character is normally allowed a chance to defend against it (such as quickly covering their nose or refusing to breathe in from that point forward) that is forfeit.

STACK Either increase the bonus to Checks and automatic affects by +/-5 and +/-2 respectively or make the Perception Checks harder by +5.

PHANTOMBINDING

TRADITION Calling

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 6 Hour

EFFECT While the spell is cast, all those in the Shape of the spell have an ancestral spirit following them around. This is obvious to anyone seeing the target. This prevents the character from effectively sneaking (as the ghost will make no effort to hide itself) and it keeps the person it's haunting up at night with nightmarish visions of it's past life - preventing the person from healing Wounds or Stress.

Every morning, the spirit enters into a Conflict with the target with d12! Appeal to try and persuade the target to visit their burial site.

STACK Increase the strength of the spirits Appeal by d12!.

PHASING

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 1 Second

EFFECT A chosen non-lead, non-organic object within the Shape of the spell becomes ethereal, allowing people to pass through it, though only at Crawling speed.

STACK Increase the speed at which you can pass through it by 1 Movement Category.

REBALANCE

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 30 seconds

EFFECT Any roll within the Shape of the spell has 1 of its dice increase 1 sized or lowered 1 sized.

STACK Increase an additional dice.

REORIENT

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 40 ft

INTERVAL 30 seconds

EFFECT The caster changes the Facing of everyone within the Shape of the spell by 1. This happens regardless of the speed they’re going at or what they’re doing. They may do this at the beginning of each Interval and each person can be changed in a different direction.

STACK Change everyone an additional Facing.

REPAIR

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 30 seconds

EFFECT Equipment in the Shape of the spell becomes surrounded by a repairing dweomer. This ignores penalties inflicted because of equipment breaks or damage up to -1 while the spell is active.

STACK Increase the penalties it ignores by 1.

RICOCHET

TRADITION Sortilege

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 5 seconds

EFFECT Anyone within the shape of the spell receives a +2 to Defense, both melee and ranged.

STACK Gain an additional +2 to their Defense.

SAP POWER

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 30 Seconds

EFFECT Upon casting, everyone within the Shape of the spell gains a temporary -1 to one of their physical Stats.

STACK Increase penalty to the physical stat by 1.

SCRY

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 5 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT This causes all willing participants within the Shape of the spell to be mentally transported away - allowing them to see a place up to 1 day’s travel away, but losing touch with their surroundings, unless they specifically stay mentally around their bodies. This also gives them magical sight, allowing them to see things as they are, detecting all illusions.

STACK Travel an additional day’s travel away.

SHATTER

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 25 ft

INTERVAL 1 Minute

EFFECT One item on each person within the Shape of the spell becomes weaker, now giving the carrier a -1 to all metrics it affects as it bends the item out of shape temporarily. The caster determines which items are affected but they must be in use.

STACK Increase the penalty by 1, Should that penalty become greater than - 10, the item simply shatters under the arcane grip.

SHOCK

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 10 Second

EFFECT Everyone in the Shape of the spell takes 1d2 points of damage which hits the pain centers of the brain. Those hit need to make a Trauma check vs twice their Con.

STACK Increase the damage dice by 1 size. Give the person making Trauma Check an effective -3 to their Con.

SHROUD OF INNOCENCE

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 5

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT Those within the Shape of the spell are filled with a calming feeling, making them look favorably on one another. This lowers any negative Devotions of everyone by 1 and prevents aggressive actions to be taken. People on the outside don’t gain this benefit, so someone attacking from outside the Shape into it, can be attacked back.

STACK Decrease negative Devotions by 1. If this would bring them to below 0, they instead gain a positive Devotion to the thing they felt negatively towards.

SLOWFALL

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 5 seconds

EFFECT This changes the kinetic energy of any falling person within the Shape of the spell to potential energy, slowing their fall to a leisurely pace, 5 ft / second.

While the spell is cast, targets don’t take any fall damage. Additionally, if this spell was cast but doesn’t last the duration of the fall, the targets only take damage for the space they fall at full speed.

STACK Increase the fall speed by 2.5 ft / second. This doesn’t affect how much damage is taken after the spell is released.

SLOW METABOLISM

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL 1 Week

EFFECT Everyone in the Shape of the spell doesn’t need quite so much food and water. Lower the food that everyone needs by half pounds, full pounds, two and half pounds respectively, and water by eighth gallon and half gallon, respectively. Once the spell is released, those affected don’t suddenly become super hungry: they just go back to their normal intake.

STACK Lower the need for food by .5 lb/1 lb/2.5 lb and water by eighth gallon and half gallon

SMOKESCREEN

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL 10 seconds

EFFECT The smoke screen clouds everything, making it hard to see. The Illumination level for the area is lowered by 1. Additionally, shooting into or through the screen gives the targets a +5 to their ranged defense.

The smoke also chokes the lungs. Anyone passing through it gains a +5 to their Encumbrance until they can Take a Breather to cough out enough of the black smoke to function again.

STACK Lower Illumination by 1. Targets gain +5 to defense and those passing through gain +5 to their Encumbrance.

SILENCE

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 2 Minutes

EFFECT This dampens all sound in the Shape of the spell, increasing all Listening Check difficulties by +5.

STACK Further increase the difficulty by +5.

STITCH FLESH

TRADITION Animism

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT This forces the wounds of all people within the Shape of the spell to stitch themselves together. While effective, this is an extremely painful process and is not kind to the body. This heals 1d4! points of damage off a single wound of each target and inflicting that much Stress.

If the damage healed is greater than the target’s Wound Category, it triggers a Trauma check.

STACK Increase the amount healed by 1 dice size.

STRENGTHEN YMIR

TRADITION Occult

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 1 Hour

EFFECT All Miracles within the spell’s Shape have their dice size lowered by 1. If multiple Favor was spent, this only shrinks 1 dice. If this would lower the dice to below a d4!, simply remove it.

STACK Lower the dice an additional size. If you remove that dice and still have power left over, you may move onto lowering another die until you’ve reached your limit.

STROBE

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT The caster launches a ball of Bright strobing light that makes everything in and on the other side of the Shape of the spell hard to track. Ranged attacks, or spells that require a ranged attack, made into the flashbanged area or at targets behind them have their dice sizes reduced by 1.

STACK Decrease the dice by an additional size.

TELEKINESIS

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 5 seconds

EFFECT This allows for remote manipulation of things as if his hands were there, allowing him to push, pull, as well as do complex tasks from a safe distance.

Essentially, the caster can act as if he were present up to the edge of the Shape of the spell.

STACK Increase the Base Range by 5 ft.

TONGUES

TRADITION Occultism

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 10 Minutes

EFFECT Through mystical means, this spell gives all within the Shape of the spell the ability to read any script, even in a dead or unknown language but only if the caster is already literate in the first place and also gives the power to speak another language, effectively giving them Rank 3 in that Language and Literacy Advanced Skill.

Tongues also has an additional power: the power to spot, read, and identify glyphs without setting them off.

STACK Increase the Rank of those temporary Skill by 3.

TOUCH OF THE OTHERWORLD

TRADITION Calling

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 30 Minutes

EFFECT Anyone within the Shape of the spell feels themself uplifted, as if suddenly connected with a higher plane of existence. Because of this, they feel more confident in their beliefs. Anyone within the Shape of the spell doesn’t gain a Repercussion dice for Appealing in a Conflict.

STACK Gain another question answered.

TURN

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 2

BASE RANGE 50 ft

INTERVAL 10 Seconds

EFFECT By means of magical force, the caster is able to turn aside Undead, Elementals, and Demons, keeping them at a distance. Any Demons, Elemental or Undead inside the Shape of the spell flees at full speed until they’re out of it. Those inside it are invisible to them while the spell is active.

Undead, Elementals, and Demons that are trapped and unable to flee, begin to tear their own flesh as the mind numbing pain floods their systems, dealing them d6! damage.

STACK Increase the damage by a d6!.

TWIST TONGUE

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 10 Minutes

EFFECT Those in the Shape of the spell suddenly lost the part of speech. They reduce one of their Advanced Language Skills by 3 Ranks.

STACK Reduce the Rank of the same or another Advanced Language Skill by 3. If the person has all their languages reduced to 0, they become mute, unable to make any sound.

VERTIGO

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 20 ft

INTERVAL 15 Seconds

EFFECT Everyone’s depth perception becomes all wacky. Everyone within the Shape of the spell lowers their ranged attack dice by 1 size.

This includes spells, but also placing spells in general becomes difficult. Spells with the Near and Far Origins are d6 ft/d10 ft closers or further away from where the caster meant them.

And those affected also have a hard time reading elevation. Things look higher or lower than they actually are, causing those to stumble over smaller elevation changes. Knock Back thresholds are reduced by 5.

STACK Reduce ranged attack dice by 1 size. Near and Far Origins variance are both increased by 1 size and Knock Back Thresholds are reduced by 5.

VISUAL ILLUSION

TRADITION Glamour

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 30 Seconds

EFFECT This spell creates a 2D visual illusion up to 5 ft x 5 ft anywhere within the Shape of the spell, that may be placed either on the ground or as a freestanding ‘wall’. This illusion hooks into the minds present but has no weight or substance to it, so anyone touching it immediately knows something is up (though touch doesn’t dismiss the illusion).

STACK The illusion gains additional area equal to 5 ft x 5 ft.

WALL WALK

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 10 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT This endows a wall, magical or otherwise, within the Shape of the spell to be scaled with a Climbing Check, moving up down or sideways freell, with their feet on the wall and their body out-stretched as if standing. Other than this looking very odd, normal physics apply. Their movement is limited, however: people moving on this wall can only move up to a Crawl.

Crawling on a magic wall doesn’t cause its spell to be cast on that person.

STACK Increase the maximum Movement Category by 1.

WEAPONSHARP

TRADITION Investiture

BASE DRAIN 3

BASE RANGE 25 ft

INTERVAL 5 Seconds

EFFECT All damage within the Shape of the spell is increased by 1.

STACK Increase damage by 1.

WEB

TRADITION Charm

BASE DRAIN 1

BASE RANGE 15 ft

INTERVAL 5 Minutes

EFFECT This covers the Shape of the spell in a thin gossamer of sticky arcane webbing that restricts movement down to Strolling speed.

Anyone wishing to move faster can make a Strength check vs d20! +5 for each movement category above a walk.

STACK Increase the penalty for moving above a Stroll by +5.

Divine

ANATOMY OF THE DIVINE

COVENANTS

Divines have spheres of power that represent their aspects. These are codified into Covenants, or promises they make with their servants in exchange for a portion of the Divine’s power.

Cults of that Divine typically pick one, maybe two Covenants, of their chosen Divine to focus on.

For instance, Wülder, a Gothic god, watches over Raiding, Industry and Trade. There could be 3 different priests to Wülder, one focusing on his role as the Bridge Between Men, one seeing him as primarily a watcher over people going on cattle raids, and one worshiping him as the greater crafter and source of inspiration.

While they all worship the same Divine, the Miracles they can invoke in his name are different.

This means that priests of different cults may not get along with each other and there can even be intra-faith wars to purge heretics (those that focus on different Covenant from them).

The main bonus of Covenants is that they make Miracles within them easier to invoke. The specifics are elaborated on in the Invoking Miracles section below.

COSMIC LINKS

The Higher Planes are those that exist above the crude and primitive world and so, naturally, the Divines are linked to the events and behaviors of the celestial bodies that make their homes in the heavens.

A Cosmic Link is the specific celestial body that the Divine is associated with and it usually gives an insight to the personality of the god. The Cosmic Link doesn’t necessarily mean your Patron is primarily the Divine of that Cosmic thing. So, a Divine associated with the moon might not be primarily a moon god, in the same way that while Venus was associated with the Morning Star, she was primarily viewed as a love goddess by the Romans. Still, your holy symbols may incorporate the moon motif commonly to represent her.

For clarification’s sake: when something says “decrease” in this section’s explanations, you go down the chart by that many steps. If it says “increase” go up, so increase will always be a bonus, and decrease will always be bad.

COMET This is associated with fervent but fleeting powers. Whenever you invoke a Miracle, you gain two Honor Dice with a +3 but lose an additional Favor.

EVENING STAR The evening star is a source of strength and beauty: it's the first star to rise in the evening. When you invoke a Miracle, if you roll below the average, you gain the average instead. So, if you roll d8 and get a 3 or less, you get 4 instead.

MOON The moon is a steady force, its effects are subtle but constant. When you invoke a Miracle, if you roll two Honor Dice, keeping the highest.

MORNING STAR The morning star is the last star in the heavens before day and is a lone watcher. When you invoke a Miracle and roll the minimum amount, you don’t lose any Favor.

SUN The sun is the lord of heaven, strong and unbending, its power unquestioned. When you invoke a Miracle and roll the max amount, you don’t lose any Favor.

CYCLICAL Often hailing from older, more primitive times, the Cyclical deity represents earthly inevitabilities in a dichotomy, sometimes with themselves and sometimes with an opposing deity. This can be Spring and Summer, life and death, creation and destruction. They may be weak now, but they will wax unstoppable. When you invoke a Miracle, and roll under its average, your next Miracle gains a +1. This is cumulative.

If you roll above its average, this bonus is then removed and you get a -1 to your next Miracle. Again, this is cumulative and resets when you roll below.

So, if you have a d6! Honor Dice, and you roll a 2, the next Miracle you invoke gets a +1. That next Miracle you roll, you get a 3 for a total of 4 (because of the +1), giving you a +2 the next roll. On that roll, you roll a 5 for a total of 7 ( 5 + 2 ). The next Miracle you then invoke gets a -1.

FAVOR OF THE DIVINES

WHAT IS FAVOR?

Favor is a measure of your standing with a given god. It’s not an absolute measure, however, but more a measure of the chance that a Divine will answer your prayer. How far your Favor goes ranges widely based on how devoted you are to a god and how Honor you are.

LEVELS OF DEVOTION
